Alternatively, you can touch a creature that is willing or that has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition and force them to expend any number of these {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} in your place. This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

item.name: Whistle of the Vagrant (Rare)
entries: This tarnished brass whistle belonged to the conductor of the Ghostlight Express, imbuing it with ghastly, mysterious powers. Its metal is cold to the touch, and its sound is an unnerving shriek.
While you hold or wear the whistle, you gain a +1 bonus determined by the whistle's rarity to all saving throws, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Call the Dead (Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can blow the whistle to cast {@spell Gentle Repose|XPHB} on all dead bodies within 30 feet of you. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Sense the Undead (Rare+)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can detect the presence and location of Undead within 60 feet of you, even through {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} of any material other than iron or lead.

entries.name: Undaunted (Rare+)
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.

item.name: Whistle of the Vagrant (Very Rare)
entries: This tarnished brass whistle belonged to the conductor of the Ghostlight Express, imbuing it with ghastly, mysterious powers. Its metal is cold to the touch, and its sound is an unnerving shriek.
While you hold or wear the whistle, you gain a +2 bonus determined by the whistle's rarity to all saving throws, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Call the Dead (Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can blow the whistle to cast {@spell Gentle Repose|XPHB} on all dead bodies within 30 feet of you. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Sense the Undead (Rare+)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can detect the presence and location of Undead within 60 feet of you, even through {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} of any material other than iron or lead.

entries.name: Undaunted (Rare+)
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Call the Undead (Very Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can blow the whistle to cast {@spell Banishment|XPHB} against an Undead creature (save DC = 16 + the whistle's bonus) from it. The target always appears in a harmless demiplane resembling the interior of a train. If you maintain the spell for its full duration, the target arrives in an appropriate afterlife. Creatures with Legendary Actions automatically succeed on the saving throw. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Steam Cloud (Very Rare+)
entries: You can blow the whistle to cast {@spell Fog Cloud|XPHB} (no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required) from it. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Touched by Death (Very Rare+)
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

item.name: Whistle of the Vagrant (Legendary)
entries: This tarnished brass whistle belonged to the conductor of the Ghostlight Express, imbuing it with ghastly, mysterious powers. Its metal is cold to the touch, and its sound is an unnerving shriek.
While you hold or wear the whistle, you gain a +3 bonus determined by the whistle's rarity to all saving throws, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Call the Dead (Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can blow the whistle to cast {@spell Gentle Repose|XPHB} on all dead bodies within 30 feet of you. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Sense the Undead (Rare+)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can detect the presence and location of Undead within 60 feet of you, even through {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} of any material other than iron or lead.

entries.name: Undaunted (Rare+)
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Call the Undead (Very Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can blow the whistle to cast {@spell Banishment|XPHB} against an Undead creature (save DC = 16 + the whistle's bonus) from it. The target always appears in a harmless demiplane resembling the interior of a train. If you maintain the spell for its full duration, the target arrives in an appropriate afterlife. Creatures with Legendary Actions automatically succeed on the saving throw. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Steam Cloud (Very Rare+)
entries: You can blow the whistle to cast {@spell Fog Cloud|XPHB} (no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required) from it. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Touched by Death (Very Rare+)
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Afterlife Express (Legendary)
entries: You can blow the whistle to cast {@spell Ghastly Charge|CrookedMoon24} (takes the form of a ghost train) from it. This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

item.name: Amber Birdcage
entries: This birdcage, shaped from amber, physically replaces your torso while you are attuned to it. When your {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB} ends, it separates from you, and your torso returns to its previous state. The birdcage has the following properties.

entries.name: Sense Fiends
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can sense the location of Fiends or magical effects created by Fiends within 60 feet of yourself.

entries.name: Capture Fiend
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, choose one {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} Fiend that you can see within 60 feet of yourself. It must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or be transformed into an amber songbird and trapped in the birdcage. The songbird is an inert object until removed from the cage and released. You can remove one songbird from the cage as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. If you stop holding the bird, the Fiend reverts to its true form with all its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, and it is {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} to you.

entries.name: Consume Songbird
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can consume one amber songbird you are holding. The Fiend dies, and you can either regain one expended spell slot with a level up to half the Fiend's CR, or you can gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Fiend's CR.

entries.name: Amber Curse
entries: You have a -1 penalty to Wisdom saving throws. Each time you use the Capture Fiend or Consume Songbird properties, this penalty increases by 1.

item.name: Black Candle
entries: This broad, black tallow candle is engraved with arcane symbols. When lit, its smoke is greasy and pungent, and its flame is pale gray, but it never burns down. The candle has the following properties.

entries.name: Word of Flame and Darkness
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can light or extinguish the candle by speaking a command word while within 60 feet of it. It sheds {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} in a 30-foot radius.

entries.name: Witchlight
entries: While you are in the candle's light, you can cast a level 1 or 2 spell without expending a spell slot. When you cast a spell in this way, you can't cast that spell using the candle again for 24 hours, and you must succeed on a DC 0 Constitution saving throw or take Fire damage equal to {@dice 2d6} times the spell's level.

entries.name: Cursed Candle
entries: After you succeed or fail on the saving throw of the Witchlight property, its save DC increases by 2. This increase can't happen again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. When the DC is 10 or higher, you also have {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

item.name: Bloody Fiddle
entries: This scarlet-lacquered fiddle is warm to the touch, like the heat of fresh blood. Though it looks like it has seen better days, its sound is clear and strong.
While you hold the fiddle, you gain a +2 bonus to Charisma ({@skill Performance|XPHB}) checks, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Song of Stirred Blood
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can play a lively or stirring tune on the fiddle. Up to six creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d10} + your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and if you have Bardic Inspiration dice, you can expend and roll one to add it to the total. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Sanguine Curse
entries: The first time that you play the fiddle after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you take 1 Slashing damage that ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}. When you use the Song of Stirred Blood property, this Slashing damage increases by 1.

item.name: Chunk of Oozing Fungus
entries: This fist-sized fungal growth is a pallid color, is oozy and lumpy, and frequently fills the air with spores. The fungus has the following properties.

entries.name: Spore Cloud
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can throw the fungus up to 30 feet. The fungus is destroyed and explodes into a cloud of spores in a 30-foot {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on that point. Each creature other than you in the area must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 3d8} Poison damage and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more also has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. On a successful save, a target takes half damage only.

entries.name: Regrow
entries: You can grow another Chunk of Oozing Fungus by coughing green-black spores into your hand as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. When you do so, you must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum decreases by 5.

entries.name: Fungal Curse
entries: You have a -1 penalty to Constitution saving throws. This penalty increases by 1 immediately after you succeed or fail on the saving throw from the Regrow property.

item.name: Devilbone Button
entries: This bone button is found on an article of clothing, such as a shirt or coat, and is carved with the tiny image of a devil. It must be attached to clothing that you wear to attune to it. You gain a +1 bonus to saving throws, and it has the following properties.

entries.name: Improbable Luck
entries: When you fail a saving throw while wearing the button, you can choose to succeed instead. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Protective Bone
entries: While wearing the button, your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum increases by 5 + your Constitution modifier.

entries.name: Diabolic Curse
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, there is a {@chance 1} chance the button is mysteriously missing and your {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB} to it ends. A devil with a CR of your level + 3 or CR 20 (whichever is lower) then becomes your enemy and seeks to destroy you. The GM determines the devil's details. When you use the Improbable Luck property, the chance the button disappears increases by 1.

item.name: Green Ribbon
entries: This green satin ribbon is just long enough to fasten around a person's neck comfortably. It's hard to think why you'd even want to remove it. While you wear the ribbon, you have a +5 bonus to Death Saving Throws, and it grants the following properties.

entries.name: Instant Attunement
entries: If the ribbon is wrapped around the neck of a dead creature that has been dead no longer than 10 days and wasn't Undead when it died, the creature returns to life as if by a {@spell Raise Dead|XPHB} spell, and it instantly attunes to the ribbon. The creature dies immediately if its {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB} to the ribbon ends or if the ribbon is removed.

entries.name: Ribbon's Mending
entries: When you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to immediately regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your level (minimum 1). Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk or until you roll a 20 on the {@dice d20} for a {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB}.

entries.name: Curse of the Ribbon
entries: Creatures other than you within 60 feet of you have a -1 penalty to Death Saving Throws. This penalty increases by 1 each time you use the Ribbon's Mending property.

item.name: Hypnovulfen Figure
entries: This carved wooden figurine depicts a crooked wolf with large, leering eyes and a wild, toothy maw. While holding the figure, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB}, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs. The figure has the following properties.

entries.name: Hypnovulfen Bite
entries: Your teeth become viciously sharp. You can bite as an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} that deals {@damage 1d6} Piercing damage instead of Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Hypnovulfen Eye
entries: While holding the figure, you can cast {@spell Confusion|XPHB} (save DC 14) with it. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Cursed Hunger
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you must succeed on a DC 0 Wisdom saving throw or you can't use the {@action Attack|XPHB} or {@action Magic|XPHB} actions except to use the figure's properties until you hit a creature with a Hypnovulfen Bite attack. When you use the Hypnovulfen Eye property, the DC of this saving throw increases by 2.

item.name: Jinxed Poker Chip
entries: This ceramic poker chip is painted with a crocodile's skull on one side. Hoarse laughter sounds when it flips. While you hold the chip, it grants the following properties.

entries.name: Jinxed Luck
entries: When you fail a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to flip the chip. Roll {@dice 1d6}. On a 4-6, you succeed on the {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} instead. After you use this property, roll {@dice 1d20}. On a 1-5, this property can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Sense Cheating
entries: If you have proficiency with a {@item Gaming Set|XPHB}, you automatically succeed on ability checks to know if someone in a game you are playing is cheating.

entries.name: Cursed Coin
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you must succeed on a DC 0 Charisma saving throw or become cursed until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. While cursed, you subtract {@dice 1d6} from {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}. When you use the Jinxed Luck property, the saving throw DC increases by 1.

item.name: Revelry Suit
entries: This bulky suit is made from natural materials, including fur, canvas, and straw. Its mask is exceptionally oversized and shaped into a sun, smiling in an unsettling way. While you wear this armor, you gain a +2 bonus to AC, and it grants the following properties.

entries.name: Dancing Dodge
entries: When you fail a Dexterity saving throw, if your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} isn't 0, you can use this property to succeed instead. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Wild Steps
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can move up to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

entries.name: Dancing Curse
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you must make a DC 0 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you gain the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, and your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 until the start of your next turn as you perform a folk dance. When you use the Dancing Dodge or Wild Steps properties, the DC of the saving throw increases by 2. The DC of this curse can't increase again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

item.name: Midwife Shears
entries: These scissors are shaped to resemble a stork. Their blades are forever wickedly sharp, and the threads they cut are more than merely physical.

entries.name: Cut the Unseen Thread
entries: While holding the scissors, you can cast {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB} (+4 bonus) or {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} from them. Once either spell is cast from the scissors, that spell can't be cast from them again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Curse of the Severed Thread
entries: When you make a saving throw to avoid being pushed or to avoid the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, you have a -1 penalty to the roll. This penalty increases by 1 each time you use the Cut the Unseen Thread property. If you fail such a save by 5 or more, you are pushed {@dice 1d6 x 5} feet straight away from the source of the save, in addition to any other distance pushed.

item.name: The Bag
entries: This weathered old satchel has three tarnished silver buckles that hold it shut. There are faint bloodstains on the inside of the flap, and the bag occasionally ripples as if something inside is moving. The bag functions as a {@item Bag of Holding|XDMG} and has the following additional properties.

entries.name: Inhabitant
entries: A {@creature Lurker in the Dark|CrookedMoon24} lives in the bag's extradimensional space. If reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the lurker vanishes and reappears in the bag at the next midnight. The lurker only dies if it is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by a creature holding a toy or stuffed animal once owned by a child. If the lurker is killed, the bag loses its magic, and anything in it appears in unoccupied spaces closest to the bag.

entries.name: The Bag's Claw
entries: While holding the bag, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to have the lurker in the dark lash out with its claw at a creature within 5 feet of you. Make a melee attack roll with a +7 bonus. On a hit, the claw deals {@damage 1d10 + 4} Piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape DC 14) from the claw, and it has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the grapple ends. This property can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

entries.name: Lurker's Curse
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, roll {@dice 1d6}. On a 1, the lurker slipped out of the bag during the rest and caused mayhem in a nearby area, such as attacking people, causing livestock to sicken, or spoiling provisions.

item.name: Toy Riverboat
entries: This tiny, brightly painted boat is made in exacting detail, with smokestacks and a paddlewheel that turns, but it looks like a child's plaything. Studying it reveals a miniscule but unearthly passenger within the boat's cabin. The riverboat grants the following properties.

entries.name: Passengers
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you and up to twelve other willing, Medium or smaller creatures you can see within 30 feet of yourself shrink to Tiny size and appear aboard the riverboat, along with up to 300 pounds of gear per passenger. The boat moves over water or other liquids at 3 miles per hour and doesn't require wind. You can travel this way for up to 12 hours a day. A passenger that leaves the boat returns to its normal size.

entries.name: Unearthly Passenger
entries: You can release the riverboat onto water to cast {@spell Arcane Eye|XPHB} with it. The riverboat is the spell's sensor and only moves on water, but you can otherwise move it as normal for the spell.

entries.name: Haunting Curse
entries: When a creature leaves the riverboat, it must make a DC 0 Charisma saving throw, becoming cursed on a failed save. While cursed in this way, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Wisdom and Charisma ability checks and on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition. After you make this saving throw, the save DC increases by 2. This increase can't happen again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

item.name: Withered Hand
entries: The skin of this desiccated hand on a looped leather cord is covered with tattoos signifying dreadful hexes. The fingers seem to curl slightly when the hand is at the edge of your vision. While you hold or wear the hand, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs. The hand grants the following properties.

entries.name: Withering Grasp
entries: When you make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can extend your reach to 30 feet with threads of magenta jinx magic. When you do so, on a hit, you deal Necrotic damage instead of Bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a creature no more than one size larger than you, you can give it the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition with the threads. The escape DC for this grapple can use your spellcasting ability or Charisma (your choice) in place of your Strength. The {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition ends if you use this property against a different target.

entries.name: Withering Curse
entries: When you use the Withering Grasp property, your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum decreases by 1. Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum can't decrease again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You don't regain the {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum lost to this curse when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

item.name: Draught of the Red Hunger
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain a ravenous thirst for blood and gain the effect of the {@spell Vampiric Touch|XPHB} spell (level 6 version, no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required) for 1 minute. You can repeat the attack on subsequent turns as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} instead of a {@action Magic|XPHB} action.
This liquid is a shimmering red deeper and more intense than natural blood.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: For the duration, as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can gain the effects of the {@spell Gaseous Form|XPHB} spell (no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required) while you aren't in sunlight. You can also revert to your normal form as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action.

item.name: Elixir of Fogwalking
entries: When you drink this potion, your breath billows out in clouds of fog. For the next 10 minutes, fog and smoke don't hinder your vision, you can cast {@spell Fog Cloud|XPHB} up to three times (no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required), and you can cast {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} up to three times as long as your teleportation begins or ends in an area of fog. This bottle has a base like cobblestone. The glass widens near the top before narrowing again into an iron cap, resembling a lantern. The liquid inside is a murky gray.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: The potion's duration becomes 1 hour, and when you use this potion to cast {@spell Misty Step|XPHB}, you also gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage until the start of your next turn.

item.name: Haint Hooch
entries: When you drink from this glass jug, you become insubstantial for 1 minute. During this time, you can move through creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}, taking {@damage 1d10} Force damage if you end your turn inside an object.
The potion is stored in jugs labeled "XxX," with a skeletal smile drawn on it. The ghastly, blue-green liquor within has an overpowering smell and harsh taste.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: For the duration, you gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

item.name: Harvest Brew
entries: When you drink this potion, you are filled with good health and bounty, providing you with enough nourishment to sustain you for 1 day. For the next hour, when you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you regain additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.
The potion's bottle is made from a hollowed-out gourd, and the thick, liquid inside is a deep orange that tastes of nutmeg and cardamom.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: The additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} you regain are equal to half your level rather than your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} (minimum +2).

item.name: Jinxed Rum
entries: When you drink this brightly colored rum, your luck takes a strange turn for 1 hour. For the duration, when you make a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, roll {@dice 1d4}. On a 2-4, add the number to your roll. On a 1, roll an extra {@dice d20} and use the lowest roll for the test.
This potion is stored in a glass rum bottle marked with crossbones.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: Roll {@dice 1d6} instead of {@dice 1d4}.

item.name: Lilypad Tonic
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the {@spell Polymorph|XPHB} spell (no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required), turning you into a Frog.
This potion is found in a clay jar shaped and painted like a large frog, with a cork stopper in its back.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: The potion has six doses instead of one.

item.name: Nectar of the Green Man
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the Commune with {@skill Nature|XPHB} spell, but your experience is filled with terror and dread. You must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, for the next 8 hours, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls and ability checks while you can see a forest. You automatically succeed on the save if you have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.
This bottle is carved from wood, with a green, leafy face adorning its surface. The liquid is a deep green streaked with shades of umber.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: You can learn all five facts from Commune with {@skill Nature|XPHB}.

item.name: Nightwatcher Potion
entries: When you drink this potion, you have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} out to 120 feet for the next 24 hours. During that time, you don't need to sleep, and if you take a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can remain conscious throughout.
This clay bottle with a waxed stopper is painted with the head of a great horned owl, and the liquid within is midnight blue

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: The duration increases to 72 hours.

item.name: Reaper's Revenge
entries: When you drink this potion, you are filled with intense and violent vigor, gaining {@dice 3d8} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. For 1 minute, when one of your enemies dies within 30 feet of you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to regain {@dice 1d8} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
The base of this glass potion bottle is shaped like a skull, and the images of scythes run up its neck.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: For 1 minute after drinking this potion, when you hit a {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} creature with an attack roll and deal damage to it, the creature takes an extra {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage.

item.name: Sight of Sin
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of a {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} spell (no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required) for 10 minutes, and during that time, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) checks to discern hidden motives or deception.
This potion is stored in a round glass flask. An iron band wraps around the bottle, ornamented with a goat's skull.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: For the duration, you also gain the effect of the {@spell See Invisibility|XPHB} spell.

item.name: Silence of the Drowned
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the {@spell Silence|XPHB} spell (no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required) as a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you for 10 minutes, and for the duration, squid tentacles emerge from your mouth.
This sculpted clay jar is painted in a deep blue and adorned with squid tentacles. Uncorking it reduces all noise in the area as if you are underwater, and the liquid within is a coppery blue-green.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: For the duration, you can spit ink from your mouth as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. One creature within 30 feet of you makes a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target is immune to this property for the next 24 hours.

item.name: Tincture of Mourning
entries: When you drink this potion, you weep with inexpressible sorrow for 1 hour. During that time, you have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition, but your continued wailing prevents you from being silent. If you are {@condition Charmed|XPHB} when you drink the potion, the condition is suppressed for the duration. This glass bottle is topped with a small crypt angel carved from stone. The fluid within has the taste and consistency of tears and the colors of a rain cloud.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: Creatures within 10 feet of you that are {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} to you also gain {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition.

item.name: Wytchwood Sap
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can coat one weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition with this sticky sap and choose a damage type: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder. A creature that takes damage from the coated weapon or ammunition takes an extra {@damage 3d8} damage of the chosen type. Once applied, the sap retains its potency for 1 minute or until its damage is dealt, whichever comes first.
Wytchwood Sap is stored in small vessels made of bark with a wooden stopper that never fully contains this oozing, amber-hued tar.

entries.name: Heightened Potency
entries: If you roll the same number on two or more of the d8s, another creature of your choice within 30 feet of your target takes {@damage 2d8} damage of the same type.

reward.name: Bestial Awakening
entries: The feral world calls to your soul, howling for you to join it. You can give in to the call and transform into a beast, but the touch of silver bites you more deeply than the sharpest fang.

entries.name: Beast Skin
entries: You always have the {@spell Polymorph|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot or spell components but can target only yourself, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast it using slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spell when you cast it without a spell slot (choose the ability when you select this Dark Bargain).

entries.name: Searing Silver
entries: {@variantrule Damage|XPHB} from {@item Silvered Weapon|XDMG|Silvered Weapons} ignores any {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} or {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to damage you have. If you take damage from a Silvered Weapon or touch silver with your bare skin (or its equivalent), you can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

reward.name: Call of the Lonely
entries: In the depths of your solitude, and when your hope withered on the branch, you were granted a companion you can call on. You never have to be alone again. This companion is {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} toward you but is deeply unsettling to your allies.

entries.name: Never Alone
entries: When no other creature can see you, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to call your companion, which appears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of you. It takes the form of a person or a vague silhouette, and it uses the {@creature Doppelganger|XMM} stat block. It is {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} toward you and acts as your ally, and it takes its turn on your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} in combat. It disappears after 1 hour, when it dies, when you die, or when you use an action to politely dismiss it. When it disappears, it drops anything it was wearing or carrying.
Once you use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Precocious Friend
entries: The companion sometimes appears with trinkets, {@filter Cursed Curios|items|source=crookedmoon24|property=cursed curio}, or other items. It might tell you where it got them, or it might not (GM's choice). If it took the object from someone who misses it or wants it back, that could create difficulties for you.

entries.name: Unsettling Presence
entries: While your companion is summoned, both it and you exude a frightful air that unnerves your allies. While the companion is summoned, a creature that isn't {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} toward you that starts its turn able to see you or the companion must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the start of its next turn.

reward.name: Collector of Stories
entries: You have an insatiable desire to gather the tales of the world. Sometimes, you inadvertently take the story of meeting another person and keep it to yourself, forever.

entries.name: Gathered Tales
entries: You always have the {@spell Legend Lore|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot or spell components, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast it using slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spell when you cast it without a spell slot (choose the ability when you select this Dark Bargain).

entries.name: Hoarded Stories
entries: When you use this bargain to cast {@spell Legend Lore|XPHB} without a spell slot, a {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} NPC (the GM chooses) forgets ever meeting you. You can meet them again and attempt to rebuild a relationship, but you forever cause an unsettling discomfort in them. That NPC's attitude toward you can't ever improve beyond {@variantrule Indifferent [Attitude]|XPHB|Indifferent}, and you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on all Charisma checks against them.

reward.name: Crooked Fortune
entries: The crooked fate that governs Druskenvald has taken a liking to you. You can avoid calamity, but you must pay back your good fortune eventually.

entries.name: Cheat Fate
entries: When you fail a saving throw, you can choose to succeed instead. When you do so, if you would take half damage on a successful save, you take no damage instead. Once you use Cheat Fate, you can't use it again until you pay the price (see below).

entries.name: Delayed Price
entries: After you use Cheat Fate, your next three saving throws have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} and can't have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}, and you gain 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level when you succeed on one of the saves. Once you succeed or fail on the third saving throw, you regain the use of Cheat Fate. The powers that govern the warp and weft of fate don't take kindly to cheating outside their terms—at the GM's discretion, saving throws made intentionally or without true consequences simply to pay this price painlessly don't count.

reward.name: Cult of Personality
entries: You are a force of charm and allure with which to be reckoned. While others fall over themselves to stumble into your good graces, you might find that you end up needing them more than they need you.

entries.name: Honeyed Words
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can speak sweet words to a creature within 60 feet of you. The creature has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for 24 hours, until you use this feature again, or until you or your allies deal any damage to the target or force it to make a saving throw. The {@condition Charmed|XPHB} target is your ally and follows your commands as long as they don't require the target to harm itself. If the target carries out a command it finds odious, it makes a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw, ending the condition on itself on a success. Once the condition ends, the target is immune to this feature for 24 hours.

If the target has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition, it instead has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} until the start of your next turn, and you gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your level. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Solitary Weakness
entries: If you start your turn with no allies that you can see or hear within 20 feet of you, you lose any {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} you have from any source, and you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} until the start of your next turn.

reward.name: Hand of Death
entries: Death has no claim on you. In exchange for staying its cold hand without that hand closing, you become a maw through which death feeds on the world around you.

entries.name: Adamant Endurance
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Constitution saving throws.

entries.name: Cling to Life
entries: When you have 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of your turn, or when you die, you can instead choose to regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your maximum. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again. After using it, whenever you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} through any means, you gain only half that amount. Once a Humanoid (other than you) dies within 30 feet of you, you regain the use of this feature, and you can regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} as normal.

entries.name: Death Knell
entries: Other creatures within 10 feet of you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Death Saving Throws, and you can't restore {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to a creature with 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by any means.

reward.name: Might of the Old
entries: Ancient and primeval power dwells within the oldest forests of Druskenvald. These powers pour their strength into you but can overwhelm you with their unchanging nature.

entries.name: Ancient Might
entries: Your Strength score increases by 2, to a maximum of 22, and your Dexterity score decreases by 2.

entries.name: Primeval Strength
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can call upon the might of the ancients to raise your Strength score to 25 for 1 minute, during which time you deal double damage to objects. Once you use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Pyre's Price
entries: When you activate Primeval Strength, your skin takes on a bark-like texture, during which time you have {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to Fire damage. Your skin returns to normal when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

reward.name: Self-Serving Sacrifice
entries: You can snatch others from the jaws of death, but your own grip lingers too tightly. The feeling of saving others from suffering fills you with resolve, even as it drains the vigor from those you rescue.

entries.name: Critical Savior
entries: When a creature within 120 feet of you is subjected to a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} or is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to magically switch places with the target. Each of you teleports to the other's space. Roll a number of d6s equal to half your level. You take Force damage equal to the total rolled, you gain {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB}, and your {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level, if any, is reduced by 1. The target regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the total rolled and gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level. You can't use this feature again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Draining Presence
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, each creature within 100 feet of you loses one {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die (before spending Hit Dice in the case of finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}).

entries.name: Final Sacrifice
entries: You can cast {@spell True Resurrection|XPHB} using this bargain requiring no spell slot or spell components. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spell when you cast it without a spell slot (choose the ability when you select this Dark Bargain).

When you cast the spell this way, you die, and nothing can prevent it. Your soul is bound to torment the creature you returned to life, and you can't be raised from the dead by any means. When the creature takes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, it must roll a {@dice d20} halfway through the rest's duration. On a 1, your soul takes the form of a {@creature Wraith|XMM} within 100 feet of the creature and tries to kill it. The wraith vanishes after 8 hours, or when it dies. Once the wraith appears, it can't appear again for 30 days.

reward.name: Shrouded Spirit
entries: The pall of death drapes over you like the Shroud of Druskenvald. This shroud protects you from the depredations of the Undead, but it draws you ever nearer to their cold embrace.

entries.name: Inured to Undeath
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and effects created by Undead.

entries.name: Unholy Appetite
entries: You must consume one pound of raw flesh (it needn't be fresh) per day or suffer {@hazard Malnutrition|XPHB}.

entries.name: Withering Soul
entries: Features that detect your creature type, such as a Paladin's Divine Sense or the {@spell Detect Evil and Good|XPHB} spell, treat you as Undead if your creature type isn't Undead already.

reward.name: Skin of Coffin Nails
entries: Your body becomes as coldly unrelenting as iron nails sealing away the dead. You can shrug off staggering punishment, but the waters of the world no longer embrace you, as if spiting your defiance.

entries.name: Iron Grit
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage (your choice when you select this Dark Bargain). You can change the damage type to one of the other options when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. When you suffer a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} from the chosen damage type, it becomes a normal hit instead.

entries.name: Watery Doom
entries: When you are immersed in water or splashed with at least 1 gallon of water (such as from a bucket or being rained on), your skin tightens and grows rusty until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. During that time, your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and the time you can hold your breath are halved, and your {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the chosen damage type for Iron Grit becomes {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} instead. At the GM's discretion, other liquids can also trigger this feature.

reward.name: Stilled Hungers
entries: Food, drink, and maladies of the flesh have lost their hold over you, but these are the very things that keep a soul vital while in the land of the living. Your mind grows ravenous absent those urges—your thoughts crack with gnawing fears, and your dreams wither into crooked nightmares.

entries.name: Sated Cravings
entries: Forgoing food and drink doesn't give you {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels. You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison damage, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Tenuous Psyche
entries: You have {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to Psychic damage and {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition. A {@spell Calm Emotions|XPHB} spell cast on you suppresses this feature for its duration.

reward.name: Unquenchable Fury
entries: Anger is a powerful tool. This bargain stokes it into a formidable inferno, but it threatens to consume everything in its path.

entries.name: Furious Onslaught
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, or when you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can choose to enter a fury. While in this fury, you can make one additional melee attack when you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, and you reduce all damage you take by an amount equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. The fury ends if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, if you die, or if you end your turn and there are no creatures within 60 feet of you that you can see or hear. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You also regain the use of this feature when you kill a Humanoid.

entries.name: Red Haze
entries: While you are in a fury, you must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw at the start of each of your turns. On a successful save, you can choose to end your fury or continue it. On a failed save, you no longer make the saving throw at the start of your turns, and you regard the creature nearest to you that you can see or hear as your enemy (if there are multiple, choose one at random). On each of your turns, you must move as close to the creature as possible and take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, targeting that creature with melee attacks. If you're unable to get close enough to the creature to attack it, your turn ends after you've used up all your available movement. If the creature dies or can no longer be seen or heard by you, the next nearest creature that you can see or hear becomes your new target.

reward.name: Wing of Whispers
entries: You have been gifted with secrets that you can call upon in the form of ravens and crows to bear you aloft, but at the risk of revealing your own secrets in turn.

entries.name: Murderous Flight
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can magically gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} (and you can hover) for 10 minutes. During this time, a mass of shadows takes the shape of a murder of crows and ravens (but they aren't truly creatures). The birds appear in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you and take flight and whirl around you when you fly. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, unless you gain 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level to use it again early.

entries.name: Whispered Secrets
entries: The birds that appear when you activate Murderous Flight remain and continue to follow you until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. While the birds are present, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) checks, and the birds whisper your secrets into the minds of other creatures, granting them {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB} or {@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks made against you.

table.name: Chaotic Curses
rows: The Fool (Upright). You become a clown and are foolish and silly.
The Fool (Reverse). You cannot stop laughing. You have the most extreme case of gallows humor; the more macabre something is, the funnier it becomes to you.
The Magician (Upright). You consider being headless the ideal state of being. You believe you can remove your head and endeavor to remove the heads of your allies.
The Magician (Reverse). Everyone around you appears to have had their eyes replaced by small round black buttons.
The High Priestess (Upright). You cannot stop coughing up blood.
The High Priestess (Reverse). Every time you drink something, you feel as if you are drowning.
The Empress (Upright). You become the epitome of the deadly sin of wrath.
The Empress (Reverse). Everything you touch begins to rot.
The Emperor (Upright). You see false visions of a past where you did horrible things. They are so realistic and convincing that you begin to doubt your own reality.
The Emperor (Reverse). You believe your soul belongs to a dark entity that can come to claim it at any moment.
The Hierophant (Upright). You have an insatiable hunger for bones.
The Hierophant (Reverse). You are so incredibly sleepy, it's hard to keep your eyes open. Every time you start to fall asleep, you jolt awake as if from a nightmare.
The Lovers (Upright). You lose all sense of direction. No matter what you do or what anyone says, you believe you are lost and will never find your way.
The Lovers (Reverse). You become the epitome of the deadly sin of pride.
The Chariot (Upright). You have an overwhelming fear of death and are afraid that everything can kill you, even the most mundane things.
The Chariot (Reverse). Your third eye opens—literally. It gives you no additional powers, but you now have a third eye in the middle of your forehead.
Strength (Upright). You believe yourself to be the ferryman of the dead, and all souls must be judged by you.
Strength (Reverse). When you move, you emit the sound of leprosy bells, even though you have neither bells nor leprosy.
The Hermit (Upright). You feel your personality split in two. A dark and evil version of yourself wrestles for control over your mind.
The Hermit (Reverse). You turn into a talking black cat. You know who you are, but the people around you have no reason to believe you.
Wheel of Fortune (Upright). You become the epitome of the deadly sin of greed.
Wheel of Fortune (Reverse). You believe you are immortal—you are not.
Justice (Upright). A pox appears all over your body.
Justice (Reverse). You are incredibly unlucky. You have Disadvantage on every roll.
The Hanged Man (Upright). Every time you must make a d20 roll, you instead roll with a d12.
The Hanged Man (Reverse). A creepy mask affixes to your face, and nothing you do can remove it.
Death (Upright). Your face disappears and is replaced by smooth, featureless skin.
Death (Reverse). You become the epitome of the deadly sin of gluttony.
Temperance (Upright). Your eyes disappear from your face and appear in the palms of your hands.
Temperance (Reverse). You can only move by crawling around on all fours, and the crawling is always creepy and unsettling.
The Devil (Upright). Your head is replaced by the head of a black goat.
The Devil (Reverse). Every time you eat something, you find 1d8 human teeth inside.
The Tower (Upright). You fall madly in love with the next person you see.
The Tower (Reverse). You become incredibly gullible, and you believe everything you are told.
The Star (Upright). You become the epitome of the deadly sin of lust.
The Star (Reverse). You believe you are invisible—you are not.
The Moon (Upright). You feel like you are covered in cobwebs, yet nothing you do can stop the feeling. If you don't shake them off soon, you believe you will be cocooned.
The Moon (Reverse). You believe you are turning into a were- creature—you are not.
The Sun (Upright). Your skin shrivels and hardens, taking on a bark-like texture and appearance.
The Sun (Reverse). You believe your body has begun to rot and decay—it hasn't.
Judgement (Upright). You have an insatiable thirst for blood.
Judgement (Reverse). You become the epitome of the deadly sin of sloth.
The World (Upright). You have a mounting desire to consume brains.
The World (Reverse). You grow a pair of fangs, making it incredibly difficult to talk.

Ace of Wands (Upright). Everyone around you sounds like they are speaking unintelligible gibberish, and nothing allows you to comprehend what they are saying—not even magic that would normally allow you to understand any language.
Ace of Wands (Reverse). You believe you can talk to the dead—you cannot.
Two of Wands (Upright). You hear the voice of a dead clown antagonizing you in your mind.
Two of Wands (Reverse). You believe you are the reincarnated soul of a witch unjustly burned at the stake.
Three of Wands (Upright). You become the epitome of the deadly sin of envy.
Three of Wands (Reverse). You hallucinate that you and all your allies have turned into the undead.
Four of Wands (Upright). You believe your shadow is out to get you.
Four of Wands (Reverse). You are unable to tell a lie.
Five of Wands (Upright). A mushroom cap appears on your head like a hat, but you cannot remove it.
Five of Wands (Reverse). You are unable to tell the truth.
Six of Wands (Upright). Blood begins to pour from your eyes.
Six of Wands (Reverse). Your head is replaced by a jack-o'-lantern.
Seven of Wands (Upright). You feel like pollen clouds the air, and you cannot stop sneezing.
Seven of Wands (Reverse). You believe your body is being held together by straw, and you need to keep stuffing your clothing with it or you will collapse.
Eight of Wands (Upright). A swarm of carrion birds continually circles overhead. You believe this to be an omen of your impending death.
Eight of Wands (Reverse). You believe you are a walking, talking skeleton—you are not.
Nine of Wands (Upright). You smell the intense scent of pumpkin spice. Nothing you do makes the aroma dissipate, and it's beginning to give you a horrible headache.
Nine of Wands (Reverse). You cannot shake the feeling that you are being followed.
Ten of Wands (Upright). You see someone watching you out of the corner of your eye. When you turn to check, there is no one there.
Ten of Wands (Reverse). When you move, you hear footsteps following behind you. When you stop moving, the sound stops as well. No one else can hear this.
Page of Wands (Upright). Your legs turn into bird legs. If you happen to have bird legs, your legs turn into human legs.
Page of Wands (Reverse). All food appears and smells rotten. Rotten food instead looks delicious.
Knight of Wands (Upright). You believe the sky is filled with thousands of vicious and aggressive swarms of birds.
Knight of Wands (Reverse). You become incredibly clumsy, and you trip and fall over everything—even your own feet.
Queen of Wands (Upright). You are horribly afraid of the dark.
Queen of Wands (Reverse). You believe you are a vampire—you are not.
King of Wands (Upright). Your bones become incredibly fragile, and you can't stop breaking them.
King of Wands (Reverse). There is a worm in your brain trying to convince you to do unspeakable things.
Ace of Cups (Upright). Everyone around you appears to have an eerie, unnatural smile on their face. No matter what their true emotions, the smile never fades.
Ace of Cups (Reverse). You hear children laughing all around you. When you turn to find the source, the laughter stops, but it returns when you look away again.
Two of Cups (Upright). You believe you are dead and that no one can see or hear you, even if they say otherwise.
Two of Cups (Reverse). You believe you are being followed by a large black dog that is an omen of your impending doom.
Three of Cups (Upright). You believe you can tell the future, and you make wild claims for what is to come.
Three of Cups (Reverse). Your teeth become rotten and fall out, just to painfully regrow minutes later and then fall out again. The cycle keeps repeating itself.
Four of Cups (Upright). There is honey all over your legs, and nothing you do can remove it. Everything sticks to you.
Four of Cups (Reverse). You believe that scarabs are eating your body from the inside out.
Five of Cups (Upright). You believe that everyone around you is dead and that you are speaking to ghosts that don't realize they have died.
Five of Cups (Reverse). You become incredibly superstitious, going so far as to make up your own superstitions to justify your fear.
Six of Cups (Upright). You believe that everyone around you is a sinner and needs to be redeemed.
Six of Cups (Reverse). You randomly cough up feathers. This seems normal to you.
Seven of Cups (Upright). You believe you can communicate great distances via howl.
Seven of Cups (Reverse). You sprout a pair of membranous bat wings from your back. If you previously had wings, they are replaced by these wings. You cannot fly, though you believe you can.
Eight of Cups (Upright). You believe you can communicate via echolocation—you cannot.
Eight of Cups (Reverse). Hundreds of eyes—ever blinking, ever watching—sprout up all over your body.
Nine of Cups (Upright). You feel as if you are suffocating, almost as if you are being buried alive.
Nine of Cups (Reverse). Randomly, when you attempt to speak, grave dirt pours out of your mouth.
Ten of Cups (Upright). Worms wriggle beneath your skin, exiting your body from your mouth, eyes, and ears.

Ten of Cups (Reverse). The disembodied hand of a long-dead wizard has pledged itself to your service. This hand functions as a physical Mage Hand and can perform simple tasks for you. This seems normal to you, but everyone else that witnesses this hand is horrified by it.
Page of Cups (Upright). Every time you're injured, bugs, insects, spiders, and maggots spill out of your wounds instead of blood.
Page of Cups (Reverse). You turn into a creepy doll.
Knight of Cups (Upright). You believe spiders are crawling all over your body, and nothing you do removes them all.
Knight of Cups (Reverse). You have a horribly uncomfortable hangnail, and when you pull on it, your flesh unzips from your body.
Queen of Cups (Upright). You believe you can turn people to stone by makingeye contact with them—you cannot.
Queen of Cups (Reverse). You are overwhelmed by the smell of burning hair and flesh.
King of Cups (Upright). The first person you see appears to you as a biblically accurate angel. Every time you close your eyes, they get closer to you. Don't blink.

King of Cups (Reverse). You believe a monster lurks behind every door, and you must check twice to be safe. Roll a d20. On a 1, you see 1d100 harmless skeletons lurking behind the door. You are the only one who can see these skeletons.
Ace of Swords (Upright). Your body is covered in frost, and you freeze in place. You are unable to move.
Ace of Swords (Reverse). Your skin feels like it is melting off, and nothing you do provides relief.
Two of Swords (Upright). You believe you can send long-distance messages via the mycelium network—you cannot.
Two of Swords (Reverse). You randomly see the visions of another's demise. The only way to get the visions to stop is to tell the person what you've seen in excruciating detail.
Three of Swords (Upright). You become deathly afraid of fire—even the tiniest of flames.
Three of Swords (Reverse). Hair begins to grow all over your body. If you are already covered with hair, it all falls out.
Four of Swords (Upright). Your feet and hands swap places.
Four of Swords (Reverse). Tiny fruit flies buzz all around you. Nothing you do can rid yourself of them.
Five of Swords (Upright). You are unable to control your facial expressions. No matter how capable you are of lying, your facial expressions are over exaggerated and give away your true feelings.
Five of Swords (Reverse). It's both too hot and too cold at the same time. When you put on more layers, you feel like you're burning up. When you remove your layers, you feel like you are freezing.
Six of Swords (Upright). You believe everyone around you is whispering about you, but every time you focus on what they are saying, the whispering stops.
Six of Swords (Reverse). You are overwhelmed with an intense paranoia of the coming winter, and you feel the need to hoard random objects like a magpie—rocks, sticks, clumps of weeds, or trinkets.

Seven of Swords (Upright). You believe you are turning into a scarecrow; you are convinced that you must stand like a scarecrow with your arms out or you and your allies will be horribly devoured by swarms of birds.
Seven of Swords (Reverse). You believe the next person to speakto you is secretly planning to kill you—they are not
Eight of Swords (Upright). You feel like you have not eaten for an entire winter season. Your hunger cannot be sated, and you'd eat practically anything.
Eight of Swords (Reverse). You feel like you have eaten too much and are on the verge of being sick. Nothing provides relief.
Nine of Swords (Upright). You have an unshakeable head cold. Your nose is runny, your throat is sore, and your muscles ache. It's inconvenient and even magic can't cure it.
Nine of Swords (Reverse). You can only speak in song, rhyme, poetry, prose, rap, or other artistic outlets.
Ten of Swords (Upright). You feel the need to dance, and you cannot stop.
Ten of Swords (Reverse). You feel the need to express yourself through interpretive dance and must do so whenever you speak.
Page of Swords (Upright). Flowers begin to sprout up all around your body. You are nearly swallowed up by them and are unable to move.
Page of Swords (Reverse). You can no longer see in color. Everything is in shades of black and white.
Knight of Swords (Upright). You randomly slip bird noises into your speech. You do not realize you are doing this.
Knight of Swords (Reverse). You begin to grow feathers all over your body. If you are already covered in feathers, they all fall out.
Queen of Swords (Upright). A raven circles overhead, mocking you by mimicking your allies' voices.
Queen of Swords (Reverse). You hear the wailing death throes of those that have died at your hand. Not even the Silence spell can quiet their voices.
King of Swords (Upright). You begin to age rapidly. This does not kill you, but you suffer all other effects of an aging body.
King of Swords (Reverse). The first person you see appears to you as a clown, and you are deathly afraid of clowns.
Ace of Coins (Upright). Your skin is incredibly itchy, and nothing you do provides relief. You are beginning to believe that the only solution is to remove your skin piece by piece.
Ace of Coins (Reverse). You feel the need to juggle whatever you are holding. You believe that if you stop juggling, you will die.
Two of Coins (Upright). You turn into a marionette, and you believe you are being controlled by a puppet master that manipulates your movement using your puppet strings.
Two of Coins (Reverse). You can only speak in a whisper.
Three of Coins (Upright). All your words come out as screams no matter how hard you try to control your volume.
Three of Coins (Reverse). You are overcome by theatrics. Everything you do is overdramatic. You randomly burst into song or monologue, or you wax philosophical.
Four of Coins (Upright). Your memory is hazy; you keep forgetting things. When you forget something important, you replace it with false details, and it is clear you're doing so.
Four of Coins (Reverse). You believe everyone you meet is flirting with you—they are not.
Five of Coins (Upright). When you speak, bees pour out of your mouth and swarm those around you.
Five of Coins (Reverse). Your jaw transforms into mandibles.
Six of Coins (Upright). You believe you have preternatural strength, but you have actually become incredibly weak.
Six of Coins (Reverse). You are a mime, unable to speak, and can only communicate through pantomime.
Seven of Coins (Upright). Your body becomes covered in moss and lichen.
Seven of Coins (Reverse). You are filled with overwhelming sorrow and cannot shake it.
Eight of Coins (Upright). You feel incredibly lonely no matter how many people you are around.
Eight of Coins (Reverse). You believe you are being stalked by a witch's familiar.

Nine of Coins (Upright). You believe you have been called upon by an ancient evil to enact their dark machinations. You are their herald of doom, and you must convert those around you to this darkness.
Nine of Coins (Reverse). You believe the trees are trying to tell you the ancient secrets of the land, but the only way to truly hear their words is to bury yourself within the roots of a tree.
Ten of Coins (Upright). You believe you are a witch in need of a familiar, and the first creature you see will do.
Ten of Coins (Reverse). You think you are a bridge troll, and anyone that tries to move past you must pay a toll.
Page of Coins (Upright). You believe you are betrothed to a creature of the deep, and you must prepare to leave the surface world behind.
Page of Coins (Reverse). Whenever you open your mouth, a dense, dark fog billows out. It doesn't inhibit your speech, but it's very spooky.
Knight of Coins (Upright). You are a fool, and everyone around you perceives you as such.
Knight of Coins (Reverse). You are like a moth to the flame; you are incredibly drawn to any source of light.
Queen of Coins (Upright). Every creature you see appears to have humanoid teeth.
Queen of Coins (Reverse). The bones in your arms disappear.
King of Coins (Upright). You are haunted by the ghost of a very depressing clown.
King of Coins (Reverse). Your hair turns into wriggling venomous snakes that are friendly to you but aggressive to everyone else.

feat.name: Altered
entries: You have been changed through magic, science, or a volatile blend of the two. You have a blatant physical augmentation of your choice from the options below. The augmentation is obvious—such as with stitches, grafts of other creature's body parts, or implants—unless disguised.

entries.name: Aquatic Adaptation
entries: You have gills or mucus membranes that allow you to breathe water, and you have webbed extremities that grant you a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: You have scales, plates, or thick hide that grants you an AC of 13 + your Dexterity or Constitution modifier (choose the ability when you select this feat).

entries.name: Natural Weapons
entries: You have claws, fangs, horns, or some other natural weapon that you can use to make {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} that deal {@damage 1d8} damage on a hit. The damage is Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing as appropriate to the form.

entries.name: Night Vision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB}, its range increases by 30 feet.

feat.name: Charm Twister
entries: You know hedge remedies and hexes passed down through Old Ways teachings, and you can impart them into small wicker charms you weave. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Old Blessing
entries: You can cast the {@spell Bless|XPHB} spell once using this benefit, targeting only creatures carrying a wicker charm you've woven, and you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have. Your spellcasting ability for casting the spell in this way is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose the ability when you select this feat).

entries.name: Twisted Hex
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can weave spite into a wicker charm you touch. Choose an ability. When another creature is carrying the charm, or while this charm is within an area that the creature considers home, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on ability checks and attack rolls using the chosen ability. When the creature fails one of these rolls, it can make a Charisma saving throw, destroying the charm on a success (DC = 8 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and the ability modifier you chose for Old Blessing). You can only have one Twisted Hex charm at a time. If you make a new one, the previous one loses its magic.

feat.name: Crimson Ritualist
entries: Your study of blood magic and life force has borne fruit, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Blood Lash
entries: You learn the {@spell Blood Bolt|CrookedMoon24} cantrip. Your spellcasting ability for it is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose the ability when you select this feat).

entries.name: Bottled Life
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can perform a 1-minute ritual to transfer some of your life essence into a vessel for later use. Expend a number of {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} up to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and bleed into a vial of water or other liquid. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, a creature can drink the vial to roll the Hit Dice you expended. The creature regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the total rolled plus its Constitution modifier. The vial remains potent until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Cult Initiate
entries: Your cult instructs you in eldritch rites, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Two Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the Warlock spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose the ability when you select this feat).

entries.name: Level 1 Spell
entries: Choose a level 1 spell from the Warlock spell list. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: Whenever you gain a new level, you can replace one of the spells you chose for this feat with a different spell of the same level from the Warlock spell list.

feat.name: Dread Speech
entries: You have articulated a few words of forbidden truth that resonate with—and fray—the fabric of creation, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Eldritch Word
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can speak a magical word aloud to force a creature within 60 feet of yourself to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier; choose the ability when you select this feat). On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn. You can use this benefit safely once, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can use it again before resting, but you take {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage, which can't be reduced or prevented in any way.

entries.name: Shred Fate
entries: Your dread secrets can unravel the destiny of your foes. You always have the {@spell Bane|XPHB} spell prepared, and your spellcasting ability for it is the ability you chose for Eldritch Word. You can cast it once without Material components or a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.

feat.name: Fate Gambler
entries: Coming out ahead, whether in games of chance or in life-or-death contention, fills you with resolve and vigor. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Bet Big
entries: If you don't already have it, you gain {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} whenever you succeed on an ability check made against another creature, when you reduce a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, or when a creature fails a saving throw you forced it to make. If, in any of these cases, the creature has a CR of 0 or lacks a CR (such as another player character), you don't gain {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB}.

entries.name: Win Big
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend your {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} to gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your level.

feat.name: Ghostlight Medium
entries: You formed a mystical connection to the Ghostlight Express that affords you insight into the nature of spirits, granting the following benefits.

entries.name: Ghostly Touch
entries: When you damage a creature with the Incorporeal Movement trait, you can ignore the creature's damage {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|Resistances}, if any.

entries.name: Spirit Sense
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can sense any Undead within 60 feet of you, or any creatures in the Ethereal Plane that overlaps that area. You learn the distance and direction to any creatures you detect (or an Ethereal creature's equivalent position on your plane). Once you detect a creature with this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Grave Keeper
entries: Studying funeral rites and tending the dead's rest has made you a conduit between the worlds of the living and the dead. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Divine Channel
entries: You gain one use of the Channel Divinity feature from the Cleric class, and you can create the Turn Undead effect with it. If you already have Channel Divinity, you add this use to the feature from one class of your choice. Your save DC for this benefit is 8 plus your Wisdom modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

entries.name: Last Rites
entries: You can enact a 10-minute ritual to prepare the corpse of a Medium or smaller creature, expending at least 10 GP worth of incense, oils, linen wraps, or similar trappings. The prepared corpse can't become Undead.

feat.name: Hunter of Hunters
entries: You are adept at hunting monstrous prey, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Dead Aim
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can scrutinize a creature to spot its vulnerable points. The next time you deal damage to the creature before the start of your next turn, you ignore the creature's damage {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|Resistances}, if any.

entries.name: Studied Quarry
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ability checks made to recall information about a creature.

feat.name: Memory Starved
entries: Your mind ravenously gathers details and desperately clings to its memories and faculties, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Desperate Detail
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) checks.

entries.name: Iron Mind
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws made to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition and to avoid having your memories read or altered.

feat.name: Reveling Fool
entries: You joined a troupe of madcap revelers and learned to take on the guise of a fool, channeling otherworldly laughter and joviality. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Fool's Mask
entries: By donning a jovial mask and a fool's, jester's, or clown's costume, you take on a new identity that hides your own. In the guise of the fool, you can get away with minor transgressions against people in positions of authority or station.

entries.name: Jester's Repartee
entries: You always have the {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|XPHB|Hideous Laughter} spell prepared, and your spellcasting ability for it is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose the ability when you select this feat). You can cast it once without Material components or a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.

feat.name: Unreflected
entries: Your image is separated from you, making you unable to cast a reflection or a shadow, but you're able to easily slip notice. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Inscrutable
entries: Creatures have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) checks made against you.

entries.name: Unremarkable
entries: The loss of some part of yourself leaves you able to fade into the background. While you are within a group of at least two other creatures of your type and that there are no more than one size larger or smaller than you, you can take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action from creatures outside that group by making a Charisma ({@skill Deception|XPHB}) check instead of Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}), with no need for being behind cover or {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB}. If you are ever more than 5 feet from at least two other such creatures while hiding this way, you are revealed.

feat.name: Death Defier
entries: When the hand of death reaches for your soul, you have found a way to reject its call. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Cling to Life
entries: You add your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1) to Death Saving Throws.

entries.name: Enduring Vitality
entries: If an effect would kill you outright without Death Saving Throws or would reduce you directly to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} without dealing damage, you are instead reduced to a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your level. You can't use this benefit again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Swift Witchcraft
entries: You have honed your skills in the rituals of witchcraft and can quickly weave your magic in times of need. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Swift Invocation
entries: You can use an action to cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 minute. Once you use this benefit, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

trait.name: Aversion to Faith
entries: The alpengrendel has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls while in a consecrated area or on attack rolls against a creature holding or wearing a Holy Symbol. Regeneration. The alpengrendel regains 10 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of its turns. If the alpengrendel takes Acid or Lightning damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The alpengrendel dies only if it starts its turn with 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The alpengrendel makes one Claws attack and one Tusks attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 8}, reach 5 ft. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) Slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Cold damage.

action.name: Tusks
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 8}, reach 5 ft. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) Piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Cold damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. Frost Breath (Recharge 5-6). {@actSave con} {@dc 15}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 21 ({@damage 6d6}) Cold damage. Until the start of the alpengrendel's next turn, the target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved, and it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

monster.name: Bat Hound
languages: understands Common plus one other language but can't speak
