entries: The abomination jumps to a space within 30 feet that contains one or more Large or smaller creatures. {@actSave dex} {@dc 17}, each creature in the abomination's destination space. {@actSaveFail} 15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only, and the target is pushed 5 feet straight away from the abomination. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The abomination can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Hag's Head
entries: The abomination uses one of the following options (if the necessary head is alive); it can't use that option again until the start of its next turn:

items.name: Contagious Miasma (Centipede Hag Head)
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 18}, one creature the abomination can see within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) Poison damage and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition. While {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, it can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. The target repeats the saving throw when it finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, ending the effect on itself on a success. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: Overwhelming Doubt (Pigeon Hag Head)
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 18}, one creature the abomination can see within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: Waking Nightmare (Weasel Hag Head)
entries: {@actSave cha} {@dc 18}, one creature the abomination can see within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} 11 ({@damage 2d10}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition. While {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, the target perceives its allies as enemies but isn't compelled to act in a specific way. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the widow fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Reopened Memories
entries: At the start of her turn, if the widow can see a memento of her husband or some other reminder that forces her to realize what she's lost, she has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} and can only expend 2 uses of her Legendary Actions until the start of her next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The widow makes two Injection attacks.

action.name: Injection
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 8}, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft. {@h}1 Piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Poison damage. If the target is a creature, it has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. While {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, the target suffers one of the following effects of the widow's choice (each option can only be used once per turn):

items.name: Hyperphobic Stimulant
entries: The target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition. At the start of its turn, the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or take the Dash action and move away from the widow by the safest and shortest available route, unless there is nowhere to move.

items.name: Soporific Infusion
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 16}, the target hit by Injection. {@actSaveFail} The target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved. On its turn, it can take either an action or a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, but not both, and it can make only one attack if it takes the Attack action. Failure by 5 or More: The target has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition for 1 minute, until it takes damage, or until a creature takes an action to shake it awake.

items.name: Thaumaturgic Inhibitor
entries: If the target casts a spell, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or the spell fails, but a spell slot used to cast the spell isn't expended.

legendary.name: Alacrity
entries: The widow or a creature she is riding moves up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking Opportunity Attacks. Dose. The widow makes one Injection attack. She can't take this action again until the start of her next turn.

legendary.name: Hypertrophic Injections
entries: The widow targets herself or an ally within 5 feet and grants the target one of the following effects of her choice; she can't take this action again until the start of her next turn:

items.name: Aggression
entries: The target has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Fortitude
entries: One of the following conditions of the widow's choice ends on the target: {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, {@condition Restrained|XPHB}, {@condition Stunned|XPHB}.

items.name: Vigor
entries: The target regains 10 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

monster.name: The White Worm
languages: understands all but can't speak; telepathy 120 ft.

trait.name: Inscrutable Mind
entries: If a creature tries to read the worm's mind, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Intelligence saving throw or have the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition. The creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries: If the worm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Poisoned Knowledge
entries: If the worm uses Devour Mind on a creature that knows a special sequence of constellations and their path through the sky, at the start of the target's next turn, the worm takes 50 Psychic damage and Devour Mind ends.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The worm can burrow through solid rock at half its {@variantrule Burrow Speed|XPHB} and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The worm makes one Bite attack and uses Psychic Caress on one or two creatures.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 10 ft. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d10 + 9}) Piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Force damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 19}).

action.name: Psychic Caress
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 19}, one creature the worm can see within 60 feet. {@actSaveFail} 17 ({@damage 5d6}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the start of the worm's next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

action.name: Devour Mind (1/Day)
entries: The worm vanishes and magically enters the mind of a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The worm can't target a creature under the effect of  the {@spell Mind Blank|XPHB} or {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|XPHB} spells. While in the target's mind, the worm can't take actions, and the target experiences the worm appearing in its memories as it devours each one. At the end of each of the target's turns, it takes 88 ({@damage 16d10}) Psychic damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the target is {@variantrule Stable|XPHB} but loses all its memories permanently. Only a {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell can restore the lost memories.

Devour Mind ends if the target is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and the worm appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the target. Devour Mind can also be ended in the following ways:

items: As an action, the target mentally duels the worm  and makes a {@dc 20} ability check using Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (its choice). On a success, the worm must succeed on a Charisma saving throw with a DC equal to the check's total or Devour Mind ends.
Devour Mind ends if the target receives an effect  that ends possession, including the {@spell Dispel Evil and Good|XPHB} spell.
If the target takes damage, the worm takes Psychic damage equal to half that amount. It must succeed on a Charisma saving throw with a DC equal to the Psychic damage taken, or Devour Mind ends.

legendary.name: Slither
entries: The worm moves up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

legendary.name: Spawn Parasites
entries: The worm disgorges a slimy spray of pale, parasitic worms. {@actSave con} {@dc 20}, each creature in a 60-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} The target is infested with parasitic worms and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition. At the start of the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} target's turn, it takes 7 ({@dice 2d6}) Necrotic plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Psychic damage as the worms burrow toward its brain. A creature reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by this damage dies and then rises 24 hours later as a {@creature Wormhost Surgeon|CrookedMoon24}. The infesting worms are killed by any effect that ends the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition on the target, or if 10 Poison damage or more is dealt to it. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The worm can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Strike
entries: The worm makes one Bite attack. It can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Burning Aura
entries: At the end of the each of the Wicker Man's turns, each creature of its choice in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the Wicker Man takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Fire damage. Creatures and flammable objects in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} start burning.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the Wicker Man fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Wicker Man has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The Wicker Man can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} on every turn of combat.

trait.name: Soul Motes
entries: The Wicker Man has 3 Soul Motes. It gains 1 Soul Mote when a creature that isn't a Construct or Undead dies within 30 feet of it. The Wicker Man can expend Soul Motes to fuel Soul Mote Reactions. When the Wicker Man finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, its Soul Mote total resets to 3.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Wicker Man makes two Blazing Slam attacks.

action.name: Blazing Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 11}, reach 15 ft.  {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) Bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) Fire damage.

action.name: Cremating Flame {@recharge}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 18}, each creature in a 60-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 35 ({@damage 10d6}) Fire damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} A creature reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by this damage is reduced to ash, and its soul is absorbed into the Wicker Man. The creature can't be restored to life by any means until the wicker man is destroyed.

reaction.name: Crushing Blow (Soul Mote)
entries: {@actTrigger} The Wicker Man hits with an attack roll. {@actResponse} The Wicker Man expends 1 Soul Mote, and the hit becomes a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}.

reaction.name: Repair (Soul Mote)
entries: {@actTrigger} The Wicker Man starts its turn. {@actResponse} The Wicker Man expends 1 Soul Mote and regains 20 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

legendary.name: Burning Clutch
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 19}, one creature within 15 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 16}) from one of two hands, and it has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the grapple ends. At the start of the Wicker Man's turn, the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Fire damage. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The Wicker Man can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Slam
entries: The Wicker Man makes one Blazing Slam attack. The Wicker Man can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Stride
entries: The Wicker Man moves up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day or 5/Day in Lair)
entries: If the titan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The titan has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Runic Sever
entries: If the titan starts its turn within 50 feet of a stone at least 10 feet high and 10 feet wide that is carved with the glyph representing its forgotten creator, the titan takes 50 Necrotic damage and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The titan deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The titan makes two Massive Fist attacks. It can replace one or both attacks with a use of Thrown Boulder.

action.name: Massive Fist
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 17}, reach 20 ft. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 20}) from one of two fists, and it has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the grapple ends.

action.name: Thrown Boulder
entries: The titan hurls a boulder at a point it can see within 150 feet. {@actSave dex} {@dc 25}, each creature in a 10-foot radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on that point. {@actSaveFail} 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

action.name: Wild Roar {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 19}, each of the titan's enemies in a 100-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the titan. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the start of the titan's next turn. While {@condition Charmed|XPHB} in this way, the creature must use its action to make its most powerful melee or ranged attacks against the nearest creature it can see.

legendary.name: Arm Sweep
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 25}, each creature in a 20-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 9 ({@damage 2d8}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The titan can't use this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Crushing Hurl
entries: The titan hurls an object it is holding, a creature it is grappling, or a Large clod of earth to a space within 100 feet. {@actSave dex} {@dc 25}, each creature in the projectile's space, including a hurled creature. {@actSaveFail} 19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The titan can't use this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Stomping Stride
entries: The titan moves up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking Opportunity Attacks. It can enter a Huge or smaller creature's space, and the creature is pushed to nearest unoccupied space.

monsterFluff.name: Phillip Druskenvald
entries: Phillip Druskenvald is the lord of Druskenvald. His dapper appearance and affable personality belie the immense power he holds. While he appears to be a tall, thin man with perfectly slicked back hair and a pencil-thin mustache as black as night, the truth is that he is a timeless lord of death with his origins lost deep within the Shroud itself. . . even to him.

Despite ruling in Druskenvald for many years, he was not always the realm's master. Formerly, it had belonged to the fey goddess Kehlenn, who utilized the reincarnation magics of  the domain to rebirth souls as flora and fauna in a natural world where life was brutal and short.

Phillip is another kind of deathless being who arrived from beyond the mist eons ago. He usurped  the realm of rebirth, claiming its reincarnating powers for his own. He then reshaped the land into  his own design, even renaming it after himself. In this new afterlife, Phillip provided souls the opportunity  to be reborn as sapient mortal beings to enjoy a second chance at a "normal" life.

After the slow passage of millennia, Phillip forgot about his battle with Kehlenn or that there was ever a world before the one he forged himself. He now oversees the domain with his Crescent Court, composed of the thirteen lords and ladies of Druskenvald (see chapter 1). However, he finds governance tedious and prefers to enjoy the good life he brought to the afterlife, with all the messy and sinful comforts and indulgences that come with it.

While he maintains a general grasp of the current affairs of the thirteen major provinces of Druskenvald, Phillip is mostly ignorant of the happenings in Wickermoor Hollow, heightened by the crooked power of Kehlenn that shrouds it from his view. Even worse, while in the valley, Phillip has none of the supernatural powers that make him the most formidable being in the land.

He does not know, and will only learn too late, that in Wickermoor Hollow, Kehlenn has seized his power and weaves it toward her own aims in the creation of a newborn god of sin: the Horned King. While within the confines of the valley, Phillip is very nearly just a mortal man, which will lead to his inevitable destruction.

Phillip's newfound impotence frustrates him, but he still decides to remain in the valley after being stranded there with the characters. His curiosity is stronger than his sense of preservation, and he cannot fathom a scenario where he could be in any real danger. He sees  the presence of the characters as an opportunity  to get to the bottom of what's happening in Wickermoor Hollow while also helping the citizens he's neglected for so long.

entries.name: Friendly
entries: Phillip enjoys the company of those who appreciate his wit and the finer things in life. He is particularly drawn to individuals who intrigue him.

entries.name: Indifferent
entries: Phillip treats most people as amusing diversions, neither valuing nor dismissing them until they prove their worth.

entries.name: Hostile
entries: Phillip rarely loses his composure, but those who attempt to control him, obstruct his inquiries, or disrespect his wife Adela earn his contempt, a slight from which few ever recover.

monsterFluff.name: Adela Druskenvald
entries: Adela Druskenvald is the loving partner-in-crime of her husband Phillip. She rules Druskenvald alongside him, and while she similarly has a distaste for politics and bureaucracy, she often serves as a voice of reason and a reminder of the responsibility to help the people across the thirteen provinces.

While Phillip is an otherworldly entity from regions unknown, Adela was born a mortal woman and lived in the material world for the first three decades of her life. As a child, her paranormal experiences and prophetic visions led to her discovery of immense powers of divination and a strong connection to the spiritual world.

As a young woman, Adela's curiosity and dauntlessness brought her face-to-face with Phillip aboard the Ghostlight Express, and the two fell in love at first sight. They were quickly married, and as a Druskenvald, Adela became immortal, enjoying her endless youth by seeking every new and exciting experience she could find.

While Adela has an exceptional gift of second sight, she doubts her own abilities, which often leads to her misinterpreting her visions. Despite this anxiety and her cheerful, almost ditzy demeanor, there is reason to believe that she is far more crafty, calculating, and deliberate than she lets on.

Even with her gift of prophecy, she is powerless to stop her fate as a sacrificial lamb in the ritual to free the Crooked Queen. Throughout the adventure, her visions become increasingly grave but also more difficult to interpret.

entries.name: Friendly
entries: Adela adores those who embrace adventure, indulge in lively conversation, or humor her prophetic musings.
She enjoys the company of those who appreciate the finer things in life and challenge her perceptions.

entries.name: Indifferent
entries: Adela treats most strangers with polite curiosity, but unless they pique her interest, she remains preoccupied with her visions and pleasures, flitting from one obsession to the next without much concern.

entries.name: Hostile
entries: Adela rarely shows malice, but those who betray her trust or threaten Phillip incite an icy fury-one hidden behind a sweet smile and a seemingly careless laugh.

monsterFluff.name: Adelaide Langtree
entries: Adelaide is the eldest child of {@creature Martha Langtree|CrookedMoon24|Martha} at twenty-five years old. She was a difficult child who played over-competitively with the other children and enjoyed morbid practical jokes to peeve her unpleasant father, like hiding rat carcasses in his boots overnight. Jericho was her best friend because she had a hard time making friends with other kids her age.

As she grew older, Adelaide's antisocial behavior deepened. Jericho vanished on her twenty-fifth birthday, and ever since, she's wandered into the cornfields after her nightly work, only returning when it's time for bed. Some whisper she killed Jericho, while others claim she's searching for her only friend. None who followed her into the corn have ever returned.

Three weeks after Jericho's disappearance, she found him—now the monstrous, crow-headed demon, Raum. {@creature The Harvest Terror|CrookedMoon24} spoke with Jericho's voice, calling himself her best friend, vowing to love her if she revealed her secrets. She confessed witnessing her father's abuse and her mother's fatal act.

The demon Raum told her that he is an angel sent to reveal the evil secrets in Foxwillow. Confused, but seduced by his words, Adelaide has spent recent months gathering secrets and luring folks into the cornfields, where Raum spirits them away to wander forever in the Fields of the Crow.

entries.name: Changing Adelaide's Attitude
entries: Adelaide is fully in Raum's thrall. She can't be swayed from being {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} toward the characters.

entries.name: Adelaide's Secret
entries: In her communion with Raum, Adelaide has learned {@creature William Lodge|CrookedMoon24|William's} secret—that her brother Isaac is really her half-brother. She's been manipulated into believing that her mother's infidelity and her half-brother's birth are the real causes of her fear and suffering in childhood. She was goaded by Raum into murdering Isaac, and she hid his corpse in the basement of the Old Windmill (area J1), where it is incubating a demonic servant of the Harvest Terror.

entries.name: Learning Her Secret
entries: Adelaide's murderous secret is revealed when the characters find her brother's corpse in the Windmill Cellar (area J9b). If her mother Martha is told of what happened, Martha weeps and gives the characters a handmade brass locket her brother made for her to try and earn her love as a child.

monsterFluff.name: Alda Farnum
entries: Alda owns and manages the Green Queen Inn. She comes off as friendly, but everything is a transaction to her, whether the currency is coins, gems, art, skills, or favors. Even the most inattentive person doesn't need much time around Alda to see through her polite faÃ§ade. Her brown hair is worn up under a hat, and her perfectly tailored outfits exude an air of quiet authority.

As a young woman, Alda became disenfranchised with the Old Ways, favoring the prosperity and comfort that modernity provides. However, when she happened upon an ancient tome filled with primeval rituals that harness Kehlenn's essence, she quickly discovered that she could use such power to grow her wealth and station in life. She has since joined the cult of the Crooked Queen as a means to an end in her constant quest for riches and authority.

monsterFluff.name: Baltus Tolliver
entries: Baltus Tolliver left Wickermoor Village and traveled across Druskenvald as a young man. He returned a decade later with some wealth, a whole lot of lavish goods, and the contacts to find any strange oddity across the domain. Using a blend of charm and intimidation, Baltus established the largest trading post in the hollow. He sells everything from basic goods to rare trinkets.

He is a slender man who wears the same gray suit every night, making sure it is meticulously cleaned every evening. He's clean-shaven, and his thinning black hair betrays his upper middle age. He wears plain silver rings and smokes a decoratively carved mahogany pipe.

Although he spent his youth away from Wickermoor Hollow, Baltus is a Follower of the Old Ways that serves in the cult of the Crooked Queen. He was called home by the ever-growing strength of Kehlenn, and his wealth and trading power help fund and coordinate efforts to unleash her. His guards revere the Old Ways and the Green Queen, but they are unaware of Baltus's allegiance to the wicked cult.

monsterFluff.name: Beatrice Wells
entries: Beatrice Wells is a master carpenter and invaluable asset to Wickermoor Village. From wagons to furniture to structures, Beatrice is an expert with wood, known equally for her artistry and the sturdiness of her creations. She has a visionary quality that allows for unique and breathtaking work. She is fascinated beyond reason by the twisted architecture of the Crooked House (see chapter 12).

Beatrice, along with her husband Branden (Chaotic Good, human {@creature Commoner|XMM}) and their four young children, Robin, Lark, Jay, and Wren (Neutral Good, human noncombatant {@creature Commoner|XMM|Commoners}), live in their second-floor living quarters.

The Wells family dutifully follow the teachings of the Brightsinger (see chapter 8). As she finds free time, Beatrice started building a chapel for {@creature Weston Murdoch|CrookedMoon24} on the Abandoned Church site (area V19). The Wells family dresses in bright clothes and sing songs to each other, even as they work.

monsterFluff.name: Dani Jenkin
entries: Dani was born to {@creature Walter Jenkin|CrookedMoon24|Walter} and {@creature Gilly Jenkin|CrookedMoon24|Gilly} within a couple of weeks of their move to the mayoral manor to serve {@creature Wendel Somerton|CrookedMoon24|Mayor Somerton's} family. Now ten years old, she senses the ghosts and disturbing forces around her, knowing things a child shouldn't. Though she cannot yet control her abilities, her bond with the powers of the Old Ways grows.

monsterFluff.name: Shuck
entries: A red-furred dog that never leaves {@creature Dani Jenkin|CrookedMoon24|Dani's} side, Shuck was a stray before the Jenkins took him in. Unbeknownst to the family, Shuck is the reincarnated soul of Sally Lockwood, a victim of the Crooked House who escaped just before her death. Shuck guards Dani fiercely. If any of the characters are evil, or if they use supernatural abilities that are in any way associated with the Crooked Queen, Shuck growls at them if they get anywhere near Dani.

monsterFluff.name: Wisp
entries: The estate's gray cat has earned {@creature Walter Jenkin|CrookedMoon24|Walter's} affection but terrifies {@creature Dani Jenkin|CrookedMoon24|Dani}. The cat is no ordinary feline; it is a shapeshifted {@creature Ketgrinn|CrookedMoon24}, a Fey in service to {@creature Vessla Browntooth|CrookedMoon24}. Wisp stole Walter's voice and torments Dani by speaking to her when they are alone. {@creature Shuck|CrookedMoon24} loathes Wisp, sensing his true nature, and stays close to protect Dani from the lurking evil. If the ketgrinn's true form is exposed and slain, Walter's ability to speak is restored.

monsterFluff.name: Doris Squire
entries: Constable Doris Squire is pragmatic, laconic, and plainly dressed. She's tall and stocky, wearing her graying hair under a cap. Her steely gray eyes are alert and seem capable of peering through one's soul.
She makes a habit of speaking only when necessary, using the fewest words possible to get her point across. She leaves the niceties of community relations to her more affable deputy.

Doris openly enforces the laws of the Old Ways, but in her heart, she is one of the Fold of the Patient Lady, enjoying and maintaining a cordial relationship with the wonders of nature. Despite her stoic guise, she is a sensitive soul and secretly writes poetry to express her feelings.

monsterFluff.name: Eleanor Heyling
entries: Eleanor Heyling's love of rare books is readily apparent to anyone who enters her shop and spots her nose-deep in her newest acquisition. She will not sell a book until she's read it. Some claim that she has been cursed by her reading, while others claim she's gained magical powers from the pursuit of rigorous study.

Although she is only in her early 40s, Eleanor has the look of an older woman. A life of little sleep and eye strain has left her far-sighted and sickly. She adopted her younger sister's three children: Margery, Algernon, and Sheridan (Neutral Good, human noncombatant {@creature Commoner|XMM|Commoners}). They go to school on most nights but are otherwise left to their own devices by their eccentric aunt. In fact, they often end up caring for her more than she cares for them.

Although Eleanor has lived in Wickermoor Village all her life, she is staunchly in the camp of the Newcomers. She values all knowledge and the wisdom her collection has imparted upon her, remaining skeptical of the strange rituals and beliefs of the other factions in town.

monsterFluff.name: Finneas Trout
entries: Finneas Trout enthusiastically teaches the children of the area their letters and numbers, or other more esoteric subjects for the children whose parents value such things. A bookish young man, he wears spectacles under a mop of unkempt brown hair, and his physical features are unimposing. Finneas has a reverence of "book learning" that is seen as admirable to some and silly to others.

He came to Wickermoor Village recently from the city of Baskerton (see chapter 1), and he keeps a room at the Green Queen Inn, paid for by the town and the parents of his more affluent students, who receive additional tutoring.

Finneas falls into the camp of the Newcomers, hoping that the pure light of reason can drive away the darkness of superstition. He has also found a source of brightness in his romantic affection for the chandler, {@creature Oswick Frey|CrookedMoon24} (see area V17).

monsterFluff.name: Gaston Doray
entries: Gaston Doray is a painter whose works all contain an ethereal quality. He came into town on a fog-shrouded night a few years ago, and no one has been able to determine his history. He's quite young, with just the beginnings of a beard sprouting on his chin and cheeks.
{@creature Adela Druskenvald|CrookedMoon24} becomes quite taken with Gaston and his dream-like paintings, becoming his patron.

He has a particular candor with friends and strangers alike that some find refreshing, while others find uncomfortable. In all pursuits, he is deeply philosophical and sometimes even nonsensical to the simple folk of Wickermoor Village.

Gaston is a conduit through which Kehlenn expresses visions, which have driven him to very recently begin the initiation into the cult of the Crooked Queen. As the adventure progresses, Gaston's paintings become more and more bizarre and unsettling. By the end of the adventure, Gaston is completely unhinged and does the bidding of the worst of the Crooked Queen's followers.

monsterFluff.name: Gilly Jenkin
entries: Gilly Jenkin has known {@creature Walter Jenkin|CrookedMoon24|Walter} since they were children, and they have loved each other just as long. She is not as devoted to the Druskenvalds as her husband; her concerns lie more with their daughter. She was pregnant with {@creature Dani Jenkin|CrookedMoon24|Dani} when they first became employed by {@creature Wendel Somerton|CrookedMoon24|Mayor Somerton} over a decade ago, and she is overly protective of the girl. Gilly feels the presence of the strange forces in Wickermoor Village, and she fears her daughter Dani has some sort of strong connection to these powers.

monsterFluff.name: Hilda Brom
entries: While farms throughout the hollow feed the people, hunting for wild game is invaluable—and profitable—for times when crops fail. Hilda Brom is renowned as one of the most skilled hunters and trappers. She seems wild and unsocial to people she first meets, but her personality shines for those she knows and trusts. If a criminal escapes justice, the mayor and constable call upon her to hunt a different caliber of prey.

Hilda is a Follower of the Old Ways, finding special kinship with and reverence for the Green Queen. She has seen too much in the grim and sometimes haunted wilds to ignore the grasp of the spirit world on the land. If the characters ever get into trouble elsewhere in Wickermoor Hollow, Hilda might show up to lend a hand.

monsterFluff.name: Holly Aster
entries: Holly Aster spends most of her time in the kitchen, either preparing the ingredients for the night's baking or fussing by the ovens. Her ruddy complexion is exacerbated by the heat of the ovens, and her straight pale hair is held back with pins while she works.

Holly comes from a long line of bakers living in Wickermoor Hollow, with her mother and her grandmother both filling the role of the bread-maker for the town. Both her mother and her grandmother died on their 35th birthdays of unknown causes, and Holly is just weeks away from hitting that milestone.

Holly is a dedicated Follower of the Old Ways, and she shares a curse with her mother and grandmother: she and her progeny are doomed to die on their 35th birthdays until the Crooked Queen returns. Holly knows this, and she has a terrible dilemma: join the cult of the Crooked Queen and help usher in the return of Kehlenn or die. How she chooses to act on that is left up to you.

monsterFluff.name: Howie Butterman
entries: Howie Butterman is short and wiry, and his brown hair sticks out from his uniform cap. While he doesn't look imposing, he is quick and deadly in a fight.

Deputy Howie presents himself as the more affable of the law-enforcement duo. His friendly demeanor and helpful attitude make him more suitable than the constable at dealing with the public. He plays "good cop" to {@creature Doris Squire|CrookedMoon24|Constable Doris's} "bad cop" when dealing with lawbreakers.

In reality, Deputy Howie is a fervent cult member who works behind the scenes to bring about the return of the Crooked Queen. He uses his position of authority to move events very subtly toward her return. The arrival of {@creature Phillip Druskenvald|CrookedMoon24|Phillip} and {@creature Adela Druskenvald|CrookedMoon24|Adela} triggers him and the other servants of the Crooked Queen to put their plans into action (see chapter 8).

monsterFluff.name: Jean Myriel
entries: Jean Myriel emigrated to Wickermoor Village from Dawn's Gate several years ago. The unique methods with metalwork and strange designs he developed in his apprenticeship were seen as too bizarre and unorthodox for the conservative community. Stealing away in the dead of night and heading east, he found a home in Wickermoor Village.
While he once kept his beard wild and untamed, he's recently made the decision to trim his facial hair to make himself more "presentable." His shorter frame belies a mass of muscles beneath.

He is sure of himself and his skills, but he also knows when to accept the advice of others. After leaving the faith of the Crimson Rose behind in Dawn's Gate (see chapter 14), he has remained non-religious and upholds the ideals of the Newcomers.

monsterFluff.name: Jeremiah Stover
entries: The farmers living around Wickermoor Village work long hours and perform hard labor to keep the population fed. They have established a rudimentary union to ensure that they receive fair compensation for their work. The representative they've chosen is Jeremiah Stover, a tuber farmer whose dedication to the Old Ways, the land, and its workers makes him the perfect candidate. He works equally hard in his fields as he does in advocating for his peers.

monsterFluff.name: Jonah Sawyer
entries: Jonah has a reputation as a rugged, broad-shouldered man with a humor as hefty as his sinewed frame. As Foxwillow's butcher, he's often seen in a bloodstained apron striding through town. His signature platform shoes, worn to keep his feet dry from pigs' blood, earned him the nickname "Heels." His only daughter, Liza, has gone missing in recent nights.

Though he's truly not responsible for all Foxwillow's ills, Jonah has been on edge lately, burdened by guilt over the town's curse and the disappearance of his daughter. In a fit of rage, he cursed William Lodge, and his shame has made him antagonistic toward his neighbors (see "Foxwillow in Flames" later in this chapter).

entries.name: Changing Jonah's Attitude
entries: Suspicious by nature, Jonah is difficult to befriend. If characters talk with him about breaking the curse, he asks if they think whoever caused the curse was evil, or just misguided. His attitude increases one step to {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} if they say they'll be sympathetic to the curse-maker or that they'll keep an eye out for Liza.
If they suggest that they'll kill the person who cursed Foxwillow, he becomes fearful and {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile}, refusing to speak at length.

entries.name: Jonah's Secret
entries: Jonah has harbored resentment for {@creature William Lodge|CrookedMoon24} for years, though he no longer recalls why. By all accounts, William is well-liked and even sells livestock to the butcher. But Jonah recently discovered William had been selling him scrawnier stock than he sells to Siv Harga in Wickermoor Village, who pays a higher price for well-cared-for prize beasts.

In a fit of ire, Jonah slaughtered a lamb and invoked an old folk hex his grandmother once whispered about. He cursed William's fields and herds and—to his horror—the curse took root. Now, Foxwillow's crops and livestock wither—save for the demon-infested cornfield, which thrives unnaturally. Jonah, wracked with guilt, grows defensive, fearing the town's ruin rests on his shoulders.

entries.name: Learning His Secret
entries: As an {@action Influence|XPHB} action, characters convince Jonah to reveal this secret with a successful DC 15 Charisma ({@skill Intimidation|XPHB} or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}) check.

monsterFluff.name: Martha Langtree
entries: Martha is a widow of ten years who works her farm with the help of her three children {@creature Adelaide Langtree|CrookedMoon24|Adelaide}, Isaac, and Rosemary. Lean and toned from years of hard work, she has a brash personality and is often called a force of nature by the townsfolk.

Martha loves all her children dearly but worries for them. Adelaide has acted strangely since Ol' Jericho Sticks vanished, then Rosemary vanished a week ago. Just this dusk, Isaac went missing too and Adelaide seems unconcerned. Martha is at her wits' end and inadvertently started a brawl in the Old Windmill (see "Foxwillow in Flames" later in this chapter) while {@creature William Lodge|CrookedMoon24|William} was out of town seeking aid.

entries.name: Changing Martha's Attitude
entries: Despite the horrors occurring at her doorstep, Martha is easy to befriend. She becomes immediately {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} if they save {@creature Jonah Sawyer|CrookedMoon24|Jonah} from death in the "The Burning Mill" encounter. Otherwise, she is {@variantrule Indifferent [Attitude]|XPHB|Indifferent}.

Her attitude increases one step if the characters demonstrate selfless heroism or emotional tenderness. Her attitude decreases one step if they are selfish or try to {@action Influence|XPHB} her to learn a secret from her and fail their Charisma check.

entries.name: Martha's Secret
entries: Farmer Malachai, Martha's husband, was a violent drunk, and Martha accidentally killed him while defending herself. She has kept this secret ever since to protect her children.

entries.name: Learning Her Secret
entries: As an {@action Influence|XPHB} action, a character convinces Martha to reveal this secret with a successful DC 15 Charisma ({@skill Intimidation|XPHB} or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}) check. This secret is in addition to her extramarital role in William's secret (see above).

monsterFluff.name: Wendel Somerton
entries: Mayor Somerton is an officious, self-important man of 50 years. His short, wide frame is constantly clad in finely tailored suits that barely hold his ever-growing girth. He wears a matching bowler hat on his bald head, and his bushy gray eyebrows and handlebar mustache are waxed to maintain their shapes. His cravats are decorated with a jeweled pin in the form of an oak leaf. He does not need, but always carries, a mahogany cane with an emerald handle.

While he is tolerant and even welcoming to people of all ideologies, Mayor Somerton strongly believes in the Old Ways along with his family. However, he is completely ignorant of the wicked intentions of the cult of the Crooked Queen and only knows Kehlenn as the Green Queen, whom he deeply reveres. He serves as the leader of the Followers of the Old Ways, leading worship of the Green Queen and heading the rituals and rites to harness her power.

This has made him a useful pawn of the nefarious cult of the Crooked Queen, unknowingly enacting the plans of her servants. The most impactful of these decisions was the gifting of the Lockwood Estate to {@creature Phillip Druskenvald|CrookedMoon24} and preparing for his potential arrival. While most townsfolk, and even Wendel himself, viewed the move as a political maneuver, the idea was planted in his head by {@creature Randall Graham|CrookedMoon24} (see area V7), who knows that {@creature Phillip Druskenvald|CrookedMoon24|Phillip} is the critical piece of the final ritual to free the Crooked Queen and unleash the {@creature Horned King|CrookedMoon24}.

monsterFluff.name: Morgan
entries: Morgan does not remember their childhood. They awoke one night in Wickermoor Village as a youngster before being taken in by a goatherd and raised by his family. Morgan found their affinity for alchemy along the way, and they now act as the village's apothecary. They are friendly and kind, but they also suffer from blackouts and occasional lost time.
Morgan has a slight frame, with reddish-blonde hair that hangs over a thin face and green eyes that have a faraway look, even when they are {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on a task.

entries.name: Morgan's Mystery
entries: Morgan's mysterious past and periods of lost time are left for you to use as needed. Morgan could be a servant of one of the powers of the hollow, a reincarnation of a former powerful NPC or creature, a polymorphed monster who has forgotten their true form, or just a typical apothecary. Use Morgan as a wildcard as befits your story. If you use this advice, the alignment and statistics indicated in Morgan's description are for their apparent guise.

monsterFluff.name: Mori Shade
entries: Mori Shade deals in death. Rather than making her an outcast in the town, she's earned the respect of the people. They trust her to handle their remains with dignity and respect. She takes an interest in the various beliefs of the people, making her a good source of folklore.
A slight woman of indeterminate age, Mori has a stately, if grim, bearing. Her striking white hair is contrasted by an all-black wardrobe.

Mori does not follow the faiths of Wickermoor Hollow. Instead, she adheres to the spiritual beliefs of the Strangers (see "The Shroud" in chapter 1) who serve as ferrymen of the dead. She learned much of these beliefs from Yorgrim, the gravedigger (see chapter 19), with whom she works closely in giving the dead their proper burial.

monsterFluff.name: Old Rusty
entries: Old Rusty is an elderly man, with a mop of reddish-gray hair and a wild beard. He's been around as long as anyone can remember, and the village gives him room and board in exchange for taking care of the Founder's Round and other public areas of town. Old Rusty rarely speaks, and when he does, he uses cryptic phrases that are difficult to decipher.

Old Rusty is, unknown to even himself, Francis Patrini, the only survivor of {@creature Crooked Man|CrookedMoon24|Eustace Lockwood's} homicidal rampage years ago at the Crooked House (see chapter 12). Due to his deep connection to the supernatural happenings of the Crooked House, his motivations, goals, and allegiances can shift wildly to serve your purposes, depending on the actions of the characters.

entries.name: Friendly
entries: Rusty responds kindly to those who treat him with respect or offer assistance with his work. He may become talkative-or as close as he gets-with those who listen patiently to his cryptic musings.

entries.name: Indifferent
entries: Rusty rarely engages unless someone directly interacts with him or disrupts his routine.

entries.name: Hostile
entries: Rusty reacts aggressively to those who ridicule his speech, damage the Founder's Round, or interfere with his work. His anger is sudden and intense, sometimes shocking, even to those who know him well.

monsterFluff.name: Oswick Frey
entries: Most of the candles in town are made by Oswick, a young man who loves his job. Having lost the use of his legs as a child, Oswick moves with the aid of a special chair designed and perfected by himself and other tradespeople of the town. Wick's bright red hair and pale complexion helped earn him his nickname as much as his job.

Oswick is madly in love with {@creature Finneas Trout|CrookedMoon24} (see area V8), the schoolteacher, but he has kept the feelings to himself. Oswick's gregarious personality and fondness for sharing stories turns into awkward stammering in Finneas's presence.
Oswick is a member of the Followers of the Old Ways and provides free candles to the faithful around town so they may use them to conduct numerous rituals in honor of the Green Queen.

monsterFluff.name: Randall Graham
entries: Randall Graham is one of the most trusted folks in Wickermoor Village. Whether it's a haircut, a bothersome tooth, a quick stitch-up, a timely piece of advice, or just a friendly ear, Randall has what you need. His handsome smile, sandy brown hair and matching beard, and burly build are a fixture around town.

Randall's friendly countenance and charming ways are the perfect disguise for the town's leader of the secretive cult of the Crooked Queen that operates among the Followers of the Old Ways. He downplays his true allegiance in casual company, but he longs for Kehlenn's freedom and vengeance.

The hair, teeth, and blood he takes from his clientele are saved in a secret room in the basement of the shop for later use in rituals and spells to gain dominion over the townspeople who oppose the return of the Crooked Queen. The pigeons, centipedes, and weasels of the Vermintoll Coven often linger about the shop, fetching the pieces of the townsfolk for their hag mistresses.

monsterFluff.name: Sister Rain
entries: Sister Rain travels throughout the hollow espousing the bountiful blessings of the Patient Lady. She has no official residence in the village and instead lives in the natural environments outside of town.

She also sometimes stays with her congregants and preaches in the Founder's Round (area V9). Sister Rain's moods and demeanor are as fickle as the weather and nature that she reveres, often living a nomadic lifestyle travelling between the various communes dedicated to the Patient Lady that dot Wickermoor Hollow.

Sister Rain is a slight woman in her mid-thirties. She wears a green floral print dress that sets off her long, flowing, flaming-red hair. Her green eyes are bright with the fervor of her faith, and her features can flash between joy and anger in a moment. She wears a plain silver necklace with a pendant in the shape of a blossoming sunflower.

Sister Rain is the leader of the Fold of the Patient Lady, and she espouses the need to accept and protect the bounties of nature. Her presence is anathema to the most zealous and evil followers of the Crooked Queen.

monsterFluff.name: Siv Harga
entries: Siv Harga is a tall, solidly built woman with blonde hair that she keeps braided. Growing up, her family moved around Wickermoor Hollow as animal herders. Siv finally settled down in Wickermoor Village as an apprentice to the town's butcher. When he passed, she took over the business and proved to be more than adequate. Siv shares a nearby house with her partner Holly Aster, Holly's two daughters, and her younger brother Ulf (Neutral Good, human {@creature Commoner|XMM}), who assists her at the shop while not in school.

Her knowledge of animals is a boon not just to her profession, but to the local farmers as well. Some think her connection with the animals she butchers is supernatural, and Siv does nothing to dissuade that attitude.

Her bond with the natural world led Siv to join the Fold of the Patient Lady. She believes that nature provides if believers are respectful and thoughtful about how to give back to nature in return. Even as she slaughters animals for her customers, she says a prayer of thanks to the Patient Lady and never allows cruelty to the animals in her care.

monsterFluff.name: Solomon Roderick
entries: Solomon Roderick is a heavyset, heavily scarred man of 40 years. His skin is as hairless and rough as the stone he works with, and his brown eyes are equally cold when dealing with strangers or customers.

Roderick lives above his workshop with his eight-year-old daughter, Sofia. Her mother left the village not long after she was born, leaving Solomon to raise the girl alone. She assists him in the shop when she's not attending {@creature Finneas Trout|CrookedMoon24|Finneas Trout's} lessons.

The most skilled mason in the hollow, Solomon understands his craft and the leverage that gives him. He works with subordinates who spend their time overseeing the removal of stone from the area's quarries, leaving Solomon to manage the building and maintenance of stone structures throughout Wickermoor Village.

While he comes across as cold, calculating, and strict, Solomon is as soft-hearted as they come while in private with the people he cares for. He dotes on his daughter, whose happiness and wellness are his chief goal. Solomon is a recent convert to the Brightsinger, and his newfound faith is strong, making large donations to the church and those in need.

monsterFluff.name: The Daydreamer
entries: Sitting in a booth in one of the corners of the Dining Car is a {@creature Wayward Haint|CrookedMoon24} of a youthful boy in overalls, hungrily eating all manner of food that he repeatedly conjures forth, from long links of sausages to whole turkeys. All the while, his face is wracked with guilt as he tries to eat the feeling away.

When encountered, he is a silly daydreamer, oftentimes speaking childlike nonsense and not responding to questions with direct answers. The one thing he does share openly is the immense guilt that he feels for stealing a stone painted to look like a toad from his neighbor's garden before passing on. Because he lost the rock on the train, he will never be able to return it to her.

Bringing him the stone, which can be found in the Circus Car (area G7), fills him with determination to right the wrong he committed. Now onto his next mission, he holds up the rock and announces he's ready to face the "stone-cold truth," then disappears.
Alternatively, below are suggested resolution proficiencies:

items.name: {@item Painter's Supplies|XPHB} or {@item Forgery Kit|XPHB}:
items.entry: Give pointers and techniques to make a replacement bauble.

items.name: {@skill Insight|XPHB} or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}:
items.entry: Coax out happy memories of the neighbor and suggest that she won't even remember the stone while reminiscing.

items.name: {@skill History|XPHB} or {@skill Investigation|XPHB}:
items.entry: Speak about the capriciousness of youth and how forgivable simple transgressions are.

monsterFluff.name: The Harlequin
entries: Hanging upside down from a dangling trapeze bar fastened to the ceiling is a {@creature Wayward Haint|CrookedMoon24} of a woman dressed as a jester with a harlequin cap covered in jingling bells. Her face is wracked with shame as she dramatically tugs on her hat and performs acrobatic but painful-looking tumbles and pratfalls.

When encountered, she mostly bemoans her own foolishness and wishes she hadn't made such a terrible mistake that hurt so many people. When pressed, she explains that she accidentally opened the cage of a vicious tiger that went on a rampage and killed dozens throughout the carnival, including herself. She wishes she could be certain it could never harm anyone again.

Giving her the iron ring that had been around the tail of the wildpyre found in the Baggage Car (area G6) fills her with immeasurable relief. The shame leaves her face, and she leaps across the room to do a cartwheel as she is freed and fades away.
Alternatively, below are suggested resolution proficiencies:

items.name: {@skill Animal Handling|XPHB} or {@skill Survival|XPHB}:
items.entry: Muse on the essence of the wild animal's danger and the insufficient security measures used to contain it.

items.name: {@skill Deception|XPHB} or {@skill Nature|XPHB}:
items.entry: Suggest the tiger must have lived its life and died of natural causes by now, so no harm can come from it ever again.

items.name: {@skill Investigation|XPHB} or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}:
items.entry: {@action Help|XPHB} her come to terms with the accident and recognize other factors out of her control.

monsterFluff.name: The Jailbird
entries: Slumped up against a tattered suitcase is a {@creature Wayward Haint|CrookedMoon24} of a grizzled man in striped clothing with a ball and chain around his left ankle. His stomach grumbles with a loud, rumbling gurgle as he lets out weary groans, his face scrunched with hunger pangs.

When encountered, he is distracted by his hunger and dreamily lists off food that would be so delicious to eat. When pressed, he says that he was executed before getting the last meal of steak and eggs he was promised, and it's all he's been able to think about since.

Bringing him a plate of steak and eggs that can be conjured in the Dining Cart (area G4) perks him up, and he immediately devours the food. Contented, he wipes his mouth and pats his belly with a gratified sigh as he vanishes.
Alternatively, below are suggested resolution proficiencies:

items.name: {@item Cook's Utensils|XPHB} or {@skill History|XPHB}:
items.entry: Wax poetic about many varied and wonderful dishes to help him realize how much wonderful food he experienced.

items.name: {@skill Deception|XPHB} or {@skill Survival|XPHB}:
items.entry: Spin a yarn about  the blandness of some foods to dampen  the disappointment.

items.name: {@skill Investigation|XPHB} or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}:
items.entry: Redirect the Jailbird to other happy memories that help him see what more there was in life.

monsterFluff.name: The Mariner
entries: Shuffling through the car is a {@creature Wayward Haint|CrookedMoon24} of an old man in a sailor's coat with a clay pipe. Grumbling, he purposelessly heaves sacks of mail from one end of the car to the other as if he was loading cargo on a ship. There is a distant regretful look in his eyes as he goes about his labor.

When encountered, he only cares to talk about the sea and his long career as a sailor, captain, and lighthouse keeper, bemoaning that he died inland. He regularly mentions that he wishes he could see the sea one last time with glum wistfulness.

Bringing the Mariner the landscape painting of the coastline, which can be found in the Lounge Car (area G3), fills him with a sense of awe and reverence. He sheds a tear and remarks on the beauty of the sea before breathing an unfettered sigh and fading away.
Alternatively, below are suggested resolution proficiencies:

items.name: {@item Navigator's Tools|XPHB} or {@skill Survival|XPHB}:
items.entry: Reminisce with the Mariner about times navigating dangerous waters.

items.name: {@skill Performance|XPHB} or {@item Musical Instrument|XPHB}:
items.entry: Sing or play a lively shanty to lift his spirits.

items.name: {@skill Deception|XPHB} or {@skill Medicine|XPHB}:
items.entry: Opine about all the worst parts of sailing, including scurvy, drowning, and other miserable conditions, to help him let go.

monsterFluff.name: The Songstress
entries: Sitting in one of the velvet chairs is a {@creature Wayward Haint|CrookedMoon24} of a beautiful woman in a long, silky dress, smoking a cigarette while glumly looking out the window. Her whole being seems hollow. She only knows herself as a songstress who wished to be a famous singer in life.

When encountered, she feels empty, having never been able to find the perfect song that inspired her to give the performance of a lifetime for an audience that truly appreciated her talent. Her tastes are jazzy and romantic, and she wishes she could give one last soulful performance.

Bringing her the phonograph found in the Sleeper Car (area G2) and turning it on inspires her to sing the perfect final song. She stands at the center of the lounge and croons a love song that spurs Phillip and Adela to embrace and slowly dance to the performance. When the song concludes, she is freed, closing her eyes contentedly and fading away in peace.
When the song concludes, she is freed, closing her eyes contentedly and fading away in peace. The lyrics are as follows:
Impossible to think at all, without the thought of you  and me.
It all would fall, nothing left to hold the stars and seas apart.
Ridiculous, there ever was a world without a 'you and me.'
To not recall a 'you' at all would send it all crashing down.
Floating over the storm, love as soft as a cloud.
Incredible that through it all, the dashed and broken stardust fell,
And settled into 'you and me,' and all the time we need.
Alternatively, below are suggested resolution proficiencies:

items.name: {@item Musical Instrument|XPHB} or {@skill Performance|XPHB}:
items.entry: Join the Songstress in a duet for an emotional swan song.

items.name: {@skill Arcana|XPHB} or {@skill Insight|XPHB}:
items.entry: Consider cosmic or philosophical topics that speak to inspiration and creativity.

items.name: {@skill History|XPHB} or {@skill Investigation|XPHB}:
items.entry: Explore examples of artistic work that help inspire the Songstress.

monsterFluff.name: The Sweetheart
entries: Within the third cabin is a {@creature Wayward Haint|CrookedMoon24} of a weeping young woman, looking wistful as she longingly stares at a locket of a handsome mustachioed man with the initials J.B. underneath the portrait. She only knows herself as his sweetheart.

She is lovesick and lonely, only barely registering the characters and bemoaning having to travel to the afterlife alone. She isn't complete without her dear love, and she doesn't want to spend an eternity without him.

Giving her the love letter from Jakob Braun found in the Mail Car (area G5) makes her realize that her love is already on the other side and is waiting for her in the afterlife. She weeps with joy, hugging the tear-stained letter and her locket as she is freed and fades from view.
Alternative resolution proficiencies are:

items.name: {@item Calligrapher's Supplies|XPHB} or {@skill Performance|XPHB}:
items.entry: {@action Help|XPHB} her compose a poem or song about her love so she has something to soothe her longing for him.

items.name: {@skill History|XPHB} or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}:
items.entry: Commiserate with her with personal tales of lost and regained love or recite legends or tales of the same.

items.name: {@skill Investigation|XPHB} or {@skill Religion|XPHB}:
items.entry: Steer her to remember details of her love's qualities in a real and practical way, suggesting they will be reunited when she reaches her destination.

monsterFluff.name: The Vagrant
entries: The Vagrant, an amiable frogman with mottled green skin, serves as a "Stranger" (see chapter 1) who ferries the souls of the dead to the "other side." The Ghostlight Express is his chosen vessel for this sacred responsibility, and he serves as the ghost train's conductor and engineer. He wears the tattered garb of a vagabond, complete with a wide-brimmed hat where he always keeps three railroad spikes.

Bound by his eternal duty, the Vagrant offers safe passage to the souls of the dead who will be reborn in the realm of Druskenvald. A consummate storyteller, he believes each passenger that boards the ghost train has a tale to tell, which he is happy to do in the form of a song aided by his well-worn fiddle.

The Vagrant has a strange kinship with the Ghostlight Express as its sole caretaker. Through the eons, the few who have come to know this ferryman have wondered if the Vagrant himself is bound to the train just as much as the haints who cannot disembark. But none ever learned the truth of the frogman's origins, and his story remains a mystery.

monsterFluff.name: The Phantom Trainhopper
entries: There is one soul aboard the train who doesn't have a ticket to ride: the Phantom Trainhopper ({@creature Shadow|XMM}). In life, they were a member of a secret cult in the living world that worships Kehlenn, the Crooked Queen. Tonight, they were ritually sacrificed so their spirit could sneak aboard the {@i Ghostlight Express} on this rare evening that {@creature Phillip Druskenvald|CrookedMoon24|Phillip} and {@creature Adela Druskenvald|CrookedMoon24} are passengers.

Granted exceptional power in death by Kehlenn's chief minion, the {@creature Crooked Man|CrookedMoon24}, this malevolent shade carries a curse aboard to corrupt the spirits that the Ghostlight Locomotive uses for fuel. With help from the devouring Shroud, the Phantom Trainhopper turns the ghost train against {@creature the Vagrant|CrookedMoon24}} and strands the Druskenvalds—and coincidentally, the characters—in Wickermoor Hollow.

Once the shade releases Kehlenn's curse, it's just a matter of time before that curse reaches the Tender (area G8), and, ultimately, the locomotive. Unwittingly, the characters likely play an integral part in bringing about The Crooked Queen's goal by unsealing the final door and letting the curse in.

monsterFluff.name: Theodora Mayville
entries: Theodora Mayville is a woman in her early 30s with a tall, slender build. She has white-blonde hair that's always set in a single ponytail, but it often falls into disarray under a brown leather hat. Her violet eyes are sharp and kind. She wears plain brown clothes and gold earrings in the shape of pigeons. She cherishes her beloved carrier pigeons as her children, and one of her birds is often roosting on her shoulder.

Theodora is really Golub Graygullet, the {@creature Pigeon Hag|CrookedMoon24} and leader of the Vermintoll Coven. She alters or doctors every single letter that comes and goes from Wickermoor Village, ensuring the information in the town is controlled as much as its people's minds. When the characters discover her true identity, it triggers the events in chapter 20. She won't hesitate to discreetly aid the characters in seeking out and killing her sisters Vessla (see chapter 12) and Stonoga (see chapter 16) in the name of furthering the Crooked Queen's machinations.

monsterFluff.name: Thomasin Ardor
entries: Thomasin Ardor is the village's most proficient tailor. As a child, she fell through a large pane of glass, but her life was saved with a critical medical procedure. This trauma, in conjunction with her quiet and cool disposition, leaves her the brunt of unfounded rumors and gossip.
She often keeps folks at a distance, and the only person in town she is close with is {@creature Randall Graham|CrookedMoon24} (see area V7), who stitched her up following her childhood accident.

While Thomasin is a benevolent member of the Followers of the Old Ways and reveres the Green Queen, {@creature Randall Graham|CrookedMoon24} is attempting to leverage their relationship to subtly guide her into joining the cult of the Crooked Queen. Whether she falls to wickedness or discovers Randall's plot and rebuffs him is up to you.

monsterFluff.name: Vessla Browntooth
entries: Vessla Browntooth is the youngest of the three hags that form the Vermintoll Coven (see chapter 8). As with her sisters, she is a crooked Fey from the primeval times of Kehlenn's reign, becoming more crooked with every passing year. She delights in the vermin that earned the coven its names, particularly favoring the weasels that scurry and scrape throughout walls of the Crooked House.
Vessla is the shortest and meanest of the trio, with a nose that is as long and pointed as her teeth and many other unsavory features that evoke the weasels she cherishes and commands.

Her witchcraft specializes in the corruption and siphoning of mortal souls, which manifests through horrific nightmares and phantasmal visions. This power is enhanced by the hoard of humanoid teeth, collected by her loyal weasels and her beloved familiar, {@creature Filthy Jasper|CrookedMoon24}.

Recently, she captured {@creature Phillip Druskenvald|CrookedMoon24|Phillip} and {@creature Adela Druskenvald|CrookedMoon24} after they settled into the manor home, and she began performing an elaborate ritual to prepare their souls for sacrifice. What she doesn't know is that the sacrificial lamb is Vessla herself, as planned by her sisters, {@creature Golub Graygullet|CrookedMoon24|Golub} and {@creature Stonoga Blackstinger|CrookedMoon24|Stonoga}, as part of the long-term machinations of the Crooked Queen.

monsterFluff.name: Filthy Jasper
entries: Filthy Jasper is an abominable Monstrosity, weasel-like but disturbingly human in his features, with unsettling hands that mimic those of a man. Formed from {@creature Vessla Browntooth|CrookedMoon24|Vessla Browntooth's} nightmarish magic, Filthy Jasper obeys her every whim and leads the swarming weasels through the Crooked House and Wickermoor Village.

As wicked as his creator, Filthy Jasper revels in human suffering, particularly that of children. An eager collector of humanoid teeth for Vessla's rituals, he savors the act of tearing them from skulls with his own hands.

monsterFluff.name: Walter Jenkin
entries: A handsome and affable sort, Walter Jenkin, lost his voice within weeks of arriving. No healer could explain the sudden silence. Now, he communicates through writing and sign language, which his family also knows and can translate. Entering the manor makes him nervous, sensing its malice, though he never speaks of his fears.

Known for his loyalty and dutifulness, Walter has an almost reverent respect for {@creature Wendel Somerton|CrookedMoon24|Mayor Wendel Somerton} and his other former employers. And in this new position, he has already become devoted to the Druskenvalds, despite having only just met them.

monsterFluff.name: Weston Murdoch
entries: Weston Murdoch had his eyes opened to the power of goodness and forgiveness as a young child. His parents were both criminals who died for their crimes, and Weston was taken in by a loving family who taught him the path of light. He now strives to bring that same hope and redemption to others.

He is a charismatic man in his late twenties with sandy hair, blue eyes, and a personality that lights up a room the moment he enters. His wife and children, equally beaming and exuberant, make a powerful team of missionaries.

Weston is the leader of the Brightsingers in Wickermoor Village. The flocks of beautiful songbirds that congregate around his home are constantly at odds with the pigeons who occupy the Dovecote (area V21).

monsterFluff.name: William Lodge
entries: A tenant farmer of the wealthy Thatcher family, William lives on the outskirts of Foxwillow and tends grains and gourds while raising livestock. As such, he has a close relationship with both the people of Foxwillow and of Wickermoor Village, which he often travels to monthly for market.

entries.name: Changing William's Attitude
entries: Though {@variantrule Indifferent [Attitude]|XPHB|Indifferent} toward the characters when they meet him, his attitude increases one step to {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} if they agree to join him in saving Foxwillow. His attitude decreases one step to {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} if they intentionally cause destruction or loot the town (such as looting the statue in area J2) but increases one step if they take action to help (such as putting out fires when the town is burning).

His attitude increases one step if the characters demonstrate selfless heroism or emotional tenderness. His attitude decreases one step if they are selfish or try to {@action Influence|XPHB} him to learn a secret from him and fail their Charisma check.

entries.name: William's Secret
entries: Though unmarried himself, William had an affair with another farmer's wife, {@creature Martha Langtree|CrookedMoon24}, who soon had a son with him. This son is the middle Langtree child, Isaac.

entries.name: Learning His Secret
entries: As an {@action Influence|XPHB} action, a character convinces William to reveal this secret with a successful DC 15 Charisma ({@skill Intimidation|XPHB} or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}) check.

monsterFluff.name: Alpengrendel

entries: {@i Brute Born of Mountain Ice}

Alpengrendel are hulking creatures covered in bluish white fur, with great tusks and horns. They were born of the ice and darkness of their mountaintop homes, shaped by the unseen hands of a deity of cold stone and gloam. The bitter cold of the mountain peaks infuses both their touch and their breath. Alpengrendel draw upon the timelessness of the mountains, healing from otherwise lethal wounds in the blink of an eye. They fear only the power of lightning, which can slay them, and the power of the gods, whom they bitterly resent.

entries.name: Secret
entries: Their disdain for deities runs so deep that alpengrendel are enraged and unnerved by the trappings of faith.

monsterFluff.name: Bat Hound

entries: {@i Bloodthirsty Hunter of the Night}

Bat hounds are created through blood magic rituals that manipulate the curse of vampirism to transform a hound into a relentless stalker. Unswervingly loyal companions, bat hounds aid vampiric masters in tracking prey, able to outrun horses and their riders once they smell blood. They seek out stragglers or quarry that are escaping during a hunt and drag them back for capture.

entries.name: Secret
entries: Running water keeps bat hounds at bay and can destroy them, a lingering remnant from the vampiric curse that spawned them.

monsterFluff.name: Bayou Beast

entries: {@i Spirit Hex-Bound to the Swamp}

Bayou beasts are elemental spirits bound into great mounds of swamp plant matter through jinxcraft magic. These hulks obey their creators unfailingly, often lingering long after their death and carrying out their final orders. The hexed seals, fashioned from carved trinkets and masks, that trap the spirit in its form impart their curse on the creature's enemies.

entries.name: Secret
entries: The jinxcraft seals can be washed away with alcohol, hindering and even destroying the bayou beast.

monsterFluff.name: Boggleswarm

entries: {@i Tricksy Fey Weasels}

Boogleswarms are mischievous Fey spirits that take the form of weasels gathered into a slinking mob. These spirits covet and collect teeth of all kinds, but they favor the teeth of Humanoids most of all. Tales of tooth faeries might have their origin in boogleswarms, as  they are known to enter into agreements to trade for teeth—such as those lost by children and tucked under a pillow—for rewards, favors, or safety.

entries.name: Secret
entries: Boogleswarms go wild for sugar, whether pure or in heavily-sweetened foods like candy, and are compelled to take and consume any they find.

monsterFluff.name: Boneflayer

entries: {@i Voracious Carrion Eater}

Boneflayers are cruel, vulture-like creatures that originated from a broken fey pact. The creatures aren't content to wait for something to die and instead make their own carrion to gorge upon—they delight in snatching prey in their talons, carrying it into the air, and dropping it to its death. Boneflayers earn their name by using their sizeable, filth-riddled beaks to cleave flesh from bone and hoard the meat until it ages enough for them to enjoy.

Cults sometimes use boneflayer killing grounds as a source of bones to burn in ritual bonfires, occasionally making pacts with the creatures to pay or trade for the creature's castoffs. Villages that fear boneflayer attacks ward them off with thundering drums or gongs whenever they circle overhead.

entries.name: Secret
entries: A lingering result of the fey bargain that created them, boneflayers are disoriented and diminished by loud, thunderous noises.

monsterFluff.name: Centipede Hag

entries: {@i Hag of Pestilence and Flesh-Shaping}

Centipede hags are grotesque witches that revel in disease and filth, filling their presence with the scuttling vermin they adore. Their magic thrives in the corruption and warping of bodies, and they often engage in horrifying experimentation in grafting, swapping, and combining body parts to create nightmarish new creatures.

entries.name: Secret
entries: Centipede hags draw more than strength from the filth that covers them; it is the essence of their being. Scrubbing it away dissolves the hag.

monsterFluff.name: Corvodaemon

entries: {@i Demon of Hunger and Secrets}
Resembling a monstrous crow, the corvodaemon's sleek and twisted form soars on elongated wings tipped with razor-sharp, finger-like claws, its six amber eyes constantly seeking for prey.

Insatiable hunger for both flesh and souls—along with their accumulated secrets—gnaws at these Fiends. Their mimicry lets them take on the voice of those known and trusted by their would-be meals, luring the hapless mortals to their doom.

entries.name: Secret
entries: Savvy demon hunters bar corvodaemons with warding lines of ash prepared from feathers.

monsterFluff.name: Crimson Clergy

entries: {@i Vampiric Zealot}

Crimson clergy are Undead cultists, often created, led, and taught by a more powerful vampire. Crimson clergy view the consumption of blood—and in its use during their rituals and when casting spells—not only as necessary but sacred. Their hunger reaches beyond the limits of their fangs and claws, calling to the blood of their victims and drawing it out in scarlet ribbons.

entries.name: Secret
entries: Crimson clergy struggle to accept how monstrous they have become. They can't stand the sight of themselves and see their true visage in their reflection.

monsterFluff.name: Crooked Effigy

entries: {@i Splinter of Crooked Power}

Crooked effigies are servants of a twisted archfey known as the Crooked Queen. They are made of gnarled wood and show some bipedal and feminine features in their queen's image. Crooked effigies impale their enemies with their branch-like arms and drag foes in close, where the thorns on their bodies carry the sting of a victim's own corruption.

entries.name: Secret
entries: Crooked effigies are bound to the Old Ways, and they recoil from the tools of forging and tinkering—symbols of a growing civilization.

monsterFluff.name: Crooked Man

entries: {@i Broken Spirit of Betrayal}

The crooked man is an Undead embodiment of broken trust and the twisting of purpose. Those who die having betrayed what they hold sacred, embracing their treachery to their core, might return in this broken, gnarled form of snapped bones with a crooked grin. The creature's fingers end in curling claws that hook and hold, and the duplicity in its heart bleeds out to twist allies against one another. Despite the creature's name, anyone can become this manifestation of betrayal.

entries.name: Secret
entries: The crooked man can't abide self-sacrifice and withers in its presence.

monsterFluff.name: Crowstorm

entries: {@i Fiendish Murder}

A crowstorm is a great, swirling mass of dark feathers accompanied constant, harshly malevolent crow calls. Hundreds of fiendish birds fly in unison, their beady eyes dripping blood as they swoop down to tear at the flesh of their victims. A crowstorm's horrific caws mingle into an eerie cacophony of pleading whispers, and it robs the gift of flight from anything that draws too close.

entries.name: Secret
entries: While they might take the form of crows or possess crow bodies, crowstorms are held at bay by drawn images or crafted effigies of crows.

monsterFluff.name: Deepdreck

entries: {@i Poisoned Subterranean Wretch}

Deepdrecks were miners long ago who found themselves far too deep beneath the earth, where they were cursed and corrupted by deforming powers. Now they tunnel and dig greedily, bloated with poisonous gases.
Astute observers have noted that these monsters occasionally bear a resemblance to missing loved ones who have long been thought dead.

entries.name: Secret
entries: The toxic essence of deepdrecks is disrupted by pleasant scents such as flowers, perfume, spices, or incense.

monsterFluff.name: Drakkenhob

entries: {@i Dragon Disguised as a Festival Horse}

The drakkenhob is a draconic monster with a sinister disguise, presenting itself as an actor wearing a horse costume, such as a mounted knight or a festively clad rider. Its draconic head resembles a decorated or armored horse's head, and its sharp teeth fit together to appear like blunt, harmless decorations. The drakkenhob uses this benign guise to get close to its prey, which are typically within crowds near festivals or parades, before it summons its similarly garbed hunting hounds and strikes. Its breath is a blood-curdling wave of terror that makes lesser victims drop dead from fright alone.

entries.name: Secret
entries: Unable to resist revelry and merriment, drakkenhob are driven away by payment offered in gold or alcohol.

monsterFluff.name: Dream Eater

entries: {@i Devourer of Nightmares}

Dream eaters are horrors that feed  on the dreams, sense of identity, and some say the very souls of other creatures. Dream eaters have the bodies and wings of great owls, while their beaks are filled with blunt, humanlike teeth and hide long snaking tongues. Their feathers are drab colors on the exterior, but their wings display a dazzling cascade of rainbow hues on the undersides when unfurled.

These colors flow and shift, mesmerizing the dream eater's prey and leaving them helpless. A creature whose dreams are devoured is left in a listless, near-blank state. Without help, their victims waste away.

entries.name: Secret
entries: Dream eaters are confused by the intricate patterns on moth wings, and it disrupts their own colorful hypnosis.

monsterFluff.name: Ferryman

entries: {@i Cursed Undead Boatman}

Ferrymen are Undead created through the use of curses and jinxcraft and are doomed to ply the waters where they were raised. They pole through the bayous and rivers, and even across land on a wave of swamp water, in coffin boats. They can focus the malice of their curse through the light of their lantern poles, jinxing enemies or those who try to force a ride without payment.

entries.name: Secret
